During the meeting, the peasants rejected the increase and attacked the criminal group with guns and machetes and a clash ensued. As a result there were 10 members of La Familia Michoacan killed, and four people from the community. 14 fatalities.

They then marched on the road blocking traffic. The protesters also accused the police of trapping their children indoors in the stadium, while there was a suffocating atmosphere due to smoke and tear gas.

Two Sri Lankan Navy personnel got into the boat and assaulted the fishermen using ropes. On 7 December 2023, in Cusco (Cusco), hundreds of residents marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the resignation of president Dina Boluarte, the closure of Congress and early presidential elections to be called. They also demand the removal of the General State Attorney.

On 7 December 2023, in El Paso (Cochabamba), for the second consecutive day, residents of the Base Territorial Organization (OTB) Llauquenquiri blocked the Elias Meneses avenue as a demonstration to demand three public transport lines to allow young workers to operate with motorcycle cabs through their sector. The demonstration happened after public transportation drivers attacked four motorcycle cab drivers from their sector.

On 7 December 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), farmers members of the National Quinoa Producers Association (ANAPQUI) marched through the center of the city as a demonstration to demand the president of the Gualberto Villarroel San Jose football club manager payment on the money he owes the association for several years.

On 7 December 2023, in Oruro (Oruro), workers members of the Huajara Oruro Industrial Chamber (CIHOR) staged a demonstration to demand a law that protects their Industrial Park lands and juridic security for their companies to operate.

On 7 December 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Engenho Novo, Vicente de Carvalho, Madureira, and Mare Complex neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Fortul municipality (Arauca), a man was shot and killed and his body was found. The motive of the attack is unknown but there is presence of the ELN and FARC dissident groups in the area. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of San Jose de Ure municipality (Cordoba), military forces destroyed seven cocaine production laboratories that belonged to the Gulf Clan.

On 7 December 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), a group of residents in the Las Nieves neighborhood protested against the Air-e company over power cuts in the early morning. They claim that the company cut the power of around 150 houses despite most of the users being up to date with the payment of their electricity bills.

On 7 December 2023, in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), merchants at the Minorista Market protested because the administration was charging an additional fee. They claimed that the administration has not provided information about the reason behind the increase.

On 7 December 2023, in Jipijapa (Manabi), unionized urban transportation workers marched through the city, from Parrales y Guale citadel to the center of the city, as a demonstration to demand a municipal ordinance to be implemented to limit the people that can go on a motorcycle to one, because they are taking away their clients.

notes: On 7 December 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, thousands of people, including indigenous leaders, and members of the Seed Movement protested in zone 1. People demonstrated against the approval of the 2024 budget and the withdrawn of immunities for four judges of the Electoral Supreme Court and marched to demand a stop to corruption as well as the respect of the result of the recent elections that the Public Prosecutor's Office has been trying to revert. The protest was led by the country's president elect of the Seed Movement. This is part of a wave of nation-wide demonstrations called by the 48 Cantones de Totonicapan (Maya indigenous group) (coded separately).
On 7 December 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Canaan Gang in Lizon and Ti Bob neighbourhoods. Casualties unknown.
Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Mariani, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least two gang members during anti-gang operations in the area. At least 2 fatalities.
On 7 December 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with an unknown number of armed individuals in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

On 7 December 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members kidnapped a number of students from the Petit Seminaire Saint Martial School and from the Sacre Coeur School, in the Turgeau neighbourhood. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 7 December 2023, in Choluteca, Choluteca, a group of employees of a shrimp farm protested demanding overdue wages and severance payments. They claimed that the owners of the company were not respecting their rights. The employees called on the authorities from the Ministry of Labor to come to the location and assist them with this issue.

On 7 December 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, employees of the National Electric Power Company (ENEE) protested in front of the Secretary of Finance demanding payment for labor conquests. They demanded the payment of 200 million lempiras for the Consumer Price Index adjustment for 2023, which corresponded to more than 2,200 workers nationwide. They also demanded the payment of the inflation index for 2023, which had already been approved by the ENEE Board of Directors.

Property destruction: On 7 December 2023, in Jutiquile, Olancho, armed members of an unidentified gang shot several bullets at the police station. It is suspected that the attack was perpetrated by local gangs involved in drug traffickers to intimidate the police. It remains unknown whether there were officers in the building at the moment of the attack. There were no fatalities.

source: Jamaica Gleaner; Jamaica Observer; Loop News Jamaica
notes: On 7 December 2023, in Kingston, Kingston, overnight, two armed men shot and killed a taxi driver standing outside his vehicle on Kensington Road. One source states that he was at mechanic when the attack took place. The victim was a former police officer. His licensed firearm was stolen. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Balaclava, Saint Elizabeth, overnight, an unknown number of armed men in a motor car shot and killed a man who was having a drink at a bar, in Elim district (drive-by). Another version stated that the victim was at his gate when the shooting happened. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Little London, Westmoreland, police forces shot and killed an armed man during a clash. According to the officers, as they approached the man, who was walking with a firearm on his hand, this one ran away and opened fire on them, leading the a clash as they returned fire. A firearm was seized. 1 fatality.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Tecate, Baja California, four bodies were found half-naked and with signs of torture inside a vehicle in fraccionamiento Moctzuma. Next to the bodies, there was a cardboard with a threatening message signed by the Sinlaoa Cartel. 4 fatalities.

The Migrants were originally from Cuba, Ecuador, Honduras, Nicaragua, Dominican Republic, Guinea, China, Senegal, El Salvador and from Costa Rica.

source: Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; El Universal (Mexico); La Jornada
notes: On 7 December 2023, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, students from the Mactumactza Rural Normal School marched for the third consecutive day to demand the cancellation of the investigation files against more than 90 students and four indigenous people which started in May 2021. The normalistas complained that the police have repressed them and have prevented them from entering the central park to express their demands. During the demonstration, a group of students threw stones and hijacked vehicle. Police officers recovered three vehicles. A man and woman were injured. Both were taken to a hospital.

On 7 December 2023, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, relatives of missing people held a protest, demanding answers to the alarming number of missing people in the state. The demonstration started from the Colorores bridge, located in the Diamante area. They advanced along Belisario Dominguez Boulevard and then took Central Avenue until they reached the Government Palace.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); El Proceso; La Prensa de Monclova; La Silla Rota; La Verdad; Milenio
notes: On 7 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and elements of the Secretariat of Citizen Security (SSC) of Mexico City (police forces), in the colonia Doctores. The officers were attacked when they were going to serve a search warrant, and they repelled the attack. Some sources say there were two fatalities and others mentioned three. Fatalities coded as 2.

On 7 December 2023, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, mothers of students of the Francisco Larroyo preschool took over the facilities demanding the construction of another classroom. They assured that this kindergarten currently has more than 60 students, but it was originally built with a capacity of 41 students.

On 7 December 2023, in Celaya, Guanajuato, the student community of the Universidad Latina de Mexico marched to demand justice for the death of their classmates, and demanded a security strategy for universities and society, after the killing of five medical students from the Universidad Latina de Mexico last Sunday (coded separately).

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a man was killed and his body was found inside a plastic bag in colonia San Juan de Otates. The victim was deprived of his life in another part of the city and later abandoned here. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a Brazilian man was shot and injured in colonia Santa Rita de los Naranjos by armed individuals who arrived on a motorcycle. He was taken to receive medical attention. Municipal authorities said that the victim had been detained by the municipal police along with other men before, when they seized large quantities of marijuana and other drugs (likely drug dealer).

On 7 December 2023, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, providers from the State Institute for the Education of Youth and Adults of Guerrero (IEEJAG) blocked three streets in the center of the city to demand late payments and respect for contracts that were canceled. The demonstrators are providers of hardware, electrical services, automotive service, as well as advertising and printing. The protesters block Valerio Trujano and Cristobal Colon streets. The same group of Suppliers demonstrated outside the IEEJAG to request the intervention of the authorities, last month however, no solution has been found to their demands.

On 7 December 2023, in Tlapa de Comonfort, Guerrero, dozens of women, feminist organizations and relatives of a woman killed in Copanatoyac on December 3, marched to demand that authorities capture the suspected perpetrator, referred to as her husband. The march began at the arch of the city of Tlapa, in the Montana Alta region of Guerrero, advancing towards the Zocalo and finishing at the town hall.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Encarnacion de Diaz, Jalisco, two individuals were killed and their bodies were found wrapped in plastic bags in colonia Revolucion besides a threatening message. 2 fatalities.

On 7 December 2023, in Metepec, Mexico, friends and family of a 25-year-old young man who died due to a fight after leaving a nightclub, demonstrated to ask the authorities to clarify the case. The mobilization began on Tecnologico Avenue, in front of the municipal Public Security Directorate, and blocked the road for a few hours.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
notes: Defusal: Around 7 December 2023, in Buenavista Tomatlan, Michoacan, agents of the Secretariats of Public Security (SSP), and of the National Defense (military force), in coordination with the National Guard (GN) located and deactivated two explosive devices when they were carrying out crime prevention and deterrence patrols in this district.

On 7 December 2023, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, about 20 neighbors and other parents of the Aquiles Serdan Primary School, where a teacher was killed after a robbery act, protested in front of the facilities, to reject the high levels of insecurity and violence that the state capital and the entity in general has faced.

On 7 December 2023, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, around 130 employees of the State Center for Evaluation and Trust Control demonstrated in the Sinaloa State Congress to ask for an increase in their salaries, as they point out that they have maintained the same for 12 years.
On 7 December 2023, in San Ignacio, Sinaloa, residents of the community demonstrated in the streets against the decree to convert their lands into a protected natural reserve.

On 7 December 2023, in Altamira, Tamaulipas, former Hules Mexicanos workers protested at the main access to the company located on Avenida de la Industria to demand payment of shareholding and payment of settlements.

notes: On 7 December 2023, in Guadalupe, Zacatecas, armed men shot and injured three merchants in the Guadalupe Regional Fair 2023. Sources close to the victims revealed that the purchase of beer directly from the distribution companies could have been the reason for the attack, since armed groups that operate there monopolize the distribution of this type of beverage. One of the victims was a former public servant who also is a pre-candidate running for federal deputy for the MORENA party. A second victim was a member of a youth social organization. 3 injured.

source: El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
notes: On 7 December 2023, in Catano, Catano, in the early morning, security forces arrested the leader of La Monserrate Gang during an anti-gang operation. Seven other members of the organization were arrested, including a municipal public servant.

On 7 December 2023, in Villa Carlos Paz (Punilla, Cordoba), teachers, parents, and students marched to the IPEM 190 Carande Carro school to demand the completion of the construction of the new building and ask the authorities for information on the progress of the work, which has been delayed for several years.

On 7 December 2023, in Rio Branco (Acre), armed individuals in a car opened fire against two men in a drive-by shooting in the Quinze neighborhood. One man was killed and the other was injured. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

notes: On 7 December 2023, in Campo Grande (Mato Grosso do Sul), drug traffickers exchanged fire with federal police in the Portal da Lagoa neighborhood. One drug trafficker was killed. Police seized two tons of marijuana. Three people were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Petrolina (Pernambuco), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Joao de Deus neighbourhood. The suspects arrived at the location in a vehicle, and some of them got out of the car and fired against the victim. The suspects escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Teresina (Piaui), a man was shot and killed in the South Zone of the city. The victim's body was found with mutilated genitals on a side road. There is no information about the perpetrators. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Asuncion (Santisima Trinidad), members of the Metropolitan Area Passenger Organization (OPAMA) demonstrated in front of a transportation company to demand better services and transparency from the government in treating the potential train project that would link Asuncion and Ypacarai.

They gathered outside the United Nations Development Program (PNUD) Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands and called for protection of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR).

They chanted songs, and carried tree branches and placards demanding a 44% pay increase, following the 44% kwacha devaluation. They blocked the road with more than 10 company trucks and delivered a petition to senior management, giving them 14 days to implement the increment. This demonstration happened simultaneously with two others in Lilongwe and Mzuzu (coded separately).

The incident is suspected to be a demonstration against the dismissal of 50 workers and disciplinary hearings targeting individuals involved in a similar strike in October (coded separately).

On 7 December 2023, clashes took place between Ad Dumayni and Ash Shahari tribesmen in Thaub village in Uzlat Khabaz region (Al Udayn, Ibb) over a tribal dispute. Casualties unknown. The source accused Houthi forces of instigating tensions between the tribes that led to clashes on 5 December and resumed on 7 December.

On 7 December 2023, sons of Houthi fighters killed in confrontations with anti-Houthi forces held a Houthi-sponsored march in Sanaa - Al Sabeen Square (As Sabain, Amanat al Asimah) to denounce Israeli 'crimes' in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine.

On 7 December 2023, demonstrators held a Houthi-sponsored protest in Uzlat Bani al Dhawad region (Bani Al Awam, Hajjah) in solidarity with the Palestinian people and Houthi operations targeting Israel in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine. Houthi-affiliated political officials took part in the demonstration.
Detonation: On 7 December 2023, a hand grenade detonated in the hands of the man carrying it in Aden - Technical City (Al Mansura) killing him.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2022-) Presidential Leadership Council
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 7 December 2023, IRG 1st War Brigade forces of Ar Rizamat axis conducted drone and artillery attacks targeting Houthi forces in the mountainous areas of As Safra district (coded to Naqah) (Sadah) causing material and human losses among Houthi forces. Unclear fatalities coded as 10.

On 7 December 2023, Houthi forces held a military march that started from Hajjah City and ended near Sharas city (Hajjah) for graduates of 'Al Aqsa Flood' courses to show support for the Palestinian people in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine. The march ended with a set of live-fire exercises.

On 7 December 2023, demonstrators held a protest in Arma district (coded to Al Mafud) (Shabwah) in solidarity with the Palestinian people in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine.

source: Daily Post (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Nigerian Eye
notes: On 7 December 2023, an unidentified armed group abducted ten students of the Federal University of Lafia at their off-campus hostel in Gandu village (Lafia, Nasarawa). The armed group fired sporadically in the air before taking the students away. Other students later protested against the incessant abduction of their colleagues, coded separately.

On 7 December 2023, the youths protested along the Onitsha-Owerri Road by Obodoukwu Junction, Onitsha (Onisha North, Anambra), over the midnight arrest by the Anambra State Anti-touts Agency. The protesters lamented their incessant arrest, detention, and intimidation by the Agency's operatives. Some anti-tout officers attacked the protesters and shot sporadically at them. A stray bullet hit and killed a bystander who was standing on the balcony of his house.

On 7 December 2023, an unidentified armed group shot at the bus conveying the Sunshine Stars Football Club of Akure along the Benin-Ore Expressway, coded to Ore (Odigbo, Ondo). The gunshots injured a team official and team members. The team was travelling to Benin for a football event when the incident occurred. There were no fatalities.

On 7 December 2023, the Ambazonian abducted about 30 people including the village head, some youths and women in Belegete or Balegeta (Obanliku, Cross River). The abduction followed the attack on the community by the militia on 5 December 2023, coded separately.

assoc_actor_1: VDP: Volunteer for Defense of Homeland
actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On 7 December 2023, the Burkinabe air force carried airstrikes against JNIM militants in the hamlet of Boui-Boui, Pobe Mengao commune (Pobe-Mengao, Soum). Soldiers and volunteer fighters (VDP) conducted sweeps and seized motorcycles. Logistic, weapons and motorcycles were also destroyed. Several militants were killed. 3 fatalities coded.

assoc_actor_1: VDP: Volunteer for Defense of Homeland
actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On 7 December 2023, the Burkinabe air force carried airstrikes against JNIM militants in Guensem (Yatenga, Nord). Soldiers and volunteer fighters (VDP) conducted sweeps and seized motorcycles and motorcycles. Several militants were killed. 3 fatalities coded.

On 7 December 2023, Al Shabaab ambushed a convoy of government security forces (SNA) passing around Farah Adan village near Xarardheere town (Xarardheere, Mudug), resulting in a government soldier getting killed and three others wounded. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 7 December 2023, overnight, Al Shabaab carried out a hit-and-run attack against government security forces (SNA) at Xero Kowaad military base in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). Both sides exchanged gunfire. There were no casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 7 December 2023, Al Shabaab attacked security forces (likely police officers- the most commonly-involved security forces) in Ceel Qalow (coded to the county headquarters as Mandera, Mandera East, Mandera). The attack was initiated with RPGs and followed by an exchange of gunfire. Casualties unknown. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 7 December 2023, government security forces (SNA) and Habar Gedir clan militia conducted a joint military operation against with Al Shabaab in Baragta Gurgurte near Barag village (Xarardheere, Galgaduud). Government claimed killing more than 30 members of the armed group.
On 7 December 2023, a mob attacked and killed a man in Mdantsane (Buffalo City, Eastern Cape) after a missing six-year-old dead body was found at his home.

source: Aden al Ghad; Al Masdar; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 7 December 2023, a Houthi gunman opened fire at other Houthi fighters while they were sleeping in Aqabat al Qandha (Naman, Al Bayda) killing 3 of them and injuring 2 others. One source noted that there were different possible explanations behind the attack such as the gunman being drugged with Shabw or the incident being the result of an internal dispute.

source: Biobio Chile; Cooperativa (Chile); El Austral Valdivia; La Tercera (Chile)
notes: Property destruction: On 7 December 2023, near La Pena (Los Rios), suspected members of WAM threatened three Bolivian occupants of a house on the Rucahue estate before setting it on fire. A banner found at the site demanded the liberation of Mapuche prisoners, including a man convicted on 5 December, and opposed the Chilean State. The Los Rios region occasionally experiences attacks by Indigenous militias demanding land restitution from farmers and forestry companies.

On 7 December 2023, in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, members of the Railway Front for Union Reconstruction (Ferru) Campeche protested at the government palace to demand compensation from the federal government, which has refused to pay, after the privatization of the national railway system. This petition was replicated in other parts of the country (coded separately).

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Escarcega, Campeche, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture and inside a plastic bag near Ejidos Belen and Miguel de la Madrid. The case is apparently related with drug selling disputes. 1 fatality.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Cuernavaca, Morelos, residents of the Gualupita neighborhood blocked Calzada Leandro Valle for more than an hour, in protest for the lack of water they have experienced for five days. The shortage of drinking water was generated by the rehabilitation of the water well located in the Melchor Ocampo park.
On 7 December 2023, in Benito Juarez, Nuevo Leon, at least two armed individuals, intercepted a man in colonia Pedregal de Santa Monica and shot him at close range. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2023, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, five individuals broke into a house to kidnap a couple in the Colonia Cumbres fifth sector and demanded 400 thousand pesos for their liberation. The kidnappers restrained the victims with plastic zip ties for approximately an hour. Two were captured by police officers.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Prison Guards
source: El Norte; La Jornada; Pagina 24 Zacatecas
notes: On 7 December 2023, in Guadalupe, Zacatecas, the commander Chief of Custodians of the Cieneguillas Social Rehabilitation Center was shot and killed by members of a criminal group aboard a vehicle when he was boarding his car (likely off-duty) on Anfora Street, in the Villas Fontana subdivision. 1 fatality.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), near Imperatriz (Maranhao), the bodies of two men were found on a vicinal road with signs of violence. The bodies were found tied up and wrapped in sheets and both had signs of violence. There is no information about the perpetrators. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), in Nova Xavantina (Mato Grosso), unknown armed individuals tied a man up, beat him up, shot and killed him, and his body was found in the early hours of 7 December. One of the victim's ears was cut off. The victim was suspected of robbery the day prior. 1 fatality.

source: ABC7 (New York); Local 22 (Burlington); Spectrum News Buffalo
notes: Other: On 7 December 2023, an armed man stood outside Temple Israel and shot a pump-action shotgun into the air twice in Albany (New York). No one was injured. The incident is being investigated as a hate crime and the perpetrator was charged with illegal possession of a firearm. The man allegedly screamed 'Free Palestine' before shooting and he had told officers during the investigation that 'events in the Middle East affected him.' This event took place in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas.

On 7 December 2023, a man approached a 40-year-old Jewish man dressed in traditional attire, called him a 'dirty Jew,' punched him in the head multiple times, and stole his phone in front of 906 Eastern Parkway in New York - Brooklyn (New York) in an unprovoked attack. The victim was taken to Mount Sinai Beth Israel in stable condition. The incident is being investigated as a hate crime.
Other: Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), Patriot Front affiliates dropped a banner in Casper (Wyoming) that read 'America First' and promoting Patriot Front.
Other: Around 7 December 2023, Patriot Front Network 13 affiliates handed out food and supplies in Lancaster (Ohio) and promoted Patriot Front.

The protest was organized by Jewish Voice for Peace Kansas City and Al-Hadaf, a local Palestinian organization.

On 7 December 2023, protesters and members of IfNotNow and JewsForCeasefire rallied outside of the Boston Public Library in Copley Square in Boston (Massachusetts) to demand an immediate permanent ceasefire and to commemorate the Israeli and Palestinian victims in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas on the first day of Hanukkah.

On 7 December 2023, more than 50 pro-Palestinian students at Swarthmore College gathered in the building that houses the college's president in Swarthmore (Pennsylvania) to call for school administrators to condemn 'Israeli aggression in Gaza,' drop disciplinary warnings against pro-Palestinian student organizers, and divest from companies they say are connected to the Israeli military. On 7 December 2023, about 30 students and staff at Penn University gathered outside of the university president's office in Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) to protest against her recent comments at a congressional hearing about antisemitism. Protesters objected to her statement that determining whether or not 'calling for genocide of Jews' would constitute 'bullying or harassment' would 'depend on the context.'

notes: On 7 December 2023, members of the Union of Southern Service Workers gathered outside the State House in Columbia (South Carolina) to call on OSHA to better protect workers from unsafe working conditions and workplace injuries and illnesses.

The demonstration took place in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas.

On 7 December 2023, dozens of people gathered in Naples (Florida) to protest against a permit for a new community called Bellmar Village. According to protesters, the development of the new community would make Florida panthers go extinct. Members of South Florida Wildlands Association were present.

On 7 December 2023, people marched from the Haitian Embassy to the Dominican Consulate in Miami (Florida) to protest the living conditions of migrants in Haiti and on the Dominican Republic border. The event was organized by local immigration groups.

On 7 December 2023, in the morning, 22 members of XR blocked traffic at Pirnaischer Square in Dresden (Sachsen) to call for cleaner air and more climate protection. notes: On 7 December 2023, about 20 supporters of the socialist trade union ACOD disrupted the plenary session of the Brussels Parliament and threw flyers in Brussels - Ville de Bruxelles (Brussels) to ask more money for the public sector. On 7 December 2023, two dozen people held a vigil in Kortrijk (Vlaanderen) for the Palestinian victims of the Israel-Hamas war. Protesters gather each Thursday in support of Palestinian people.

On 7 December 2023, members of the Citizens Action for Weir Removal in the Geumgang, Nakdonggang, and Yeongsangang Rivers, a coalition of 87 civic groups, held a press conference with banners in front of the Ministry of Environment (Sejong City - Dodam), condemning the current administration's 'regressive' water-related policies over environmental concerns.

assoc_actor_1: JP: Justice Party (South Korea); GPK: Green Party Korea
notes: On 7 December 2023, members of the Justice Party (JP) and Green Party Korea (GPK) held a press conference with a banner at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo), urging other progressive parties to join the election coalition party to dismantle the two-party political system.

On 7 December 2023, North Jeolla Province's general election candidates held a press conference with a banner at the Jeollabuk-do Provincial Council (Jeonju), urging authorities to abolish the redistricting draft for the upcoming election, which lacks regional representation.

assoc_actor_1: KCTU: Korean Confederation of Trade Unions; Labor Group (South Korea)
notes: On 7 December 2023, call center employees of the National Health Insurance Service (NHIS) affiliated with the KCTU Korean Public Service and Transportation Workers' Union (KPTU) held a press conference holding banners at the KCTU Office (Seoul City - Jung), urging NHIS to hire call center employees from affiliated organizations directly as permanent workers.

assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of South Korea (2022-) Marine Corps; Military Forces of South Korea (2022-) Marine Corps
notes: On 7 December 2023, about 20 reserve forces of the Marine Corps and a Marine Colonel held a press conference with a banner near the High Military Court (Seoul City - Yongsan), calling for a fair ruling over his trial on insubordination allegations during an internal probe into the death of a young Marine Corporal in July.

assoc_actor_1: KCTU: Korean Confederation of Trade Unions; Labor Group (South Korea)
notes: On 7 December 2023, members of the Seoul Public Agency for Social Service (Seoul PASS) (KCTU affiliate) held a press conference with banners at the Seoul Metropolitan Council (Seoul City - Jung). They urged the Seoul Metropolitan Council to continue subsidizing the Seoul PASS to support public childcare services.

On 7 December 2023, about 120 to 300 members of the Korean Parents' Network for People with Disabilities (KPNPD) held a protest march ('ochetuji' rally) from Government Complex Seoul (Seoul City - Jongno) to Seoul Metropolitan Government (Seoul City - Jung), calling for integrated education and labor opportunities for people with developmental disabilities to let them live their lives on their own.

On 7 December 2023, labor activists and mother of late worker Kim Yong-gyun held a press conference with banners in front of the Supreme Court of South Korea (Seoul City - Seocho) after the acquittal of Korea Western Power (KOWEPO) and its former CEO on charges of manslaughter and violation of the Occupational Safety and Health Act. They condemned the ruling and demanded strict punishment of the contractor in the event of a fatal accident, citing the Serious Accidents Punishment Act.

On 7 December 2023, parents of children with disabilities affected by alleged child abuse at a daycare center in Jinju held a press conference and picketed in front of the Changwon District Court Jinju Division (Jinju). They urged authorities to immediately close the daycare center and disqualify the director and perpetrators from ever having access to childcare centers again. They also called for child abuse prevention measures.

On 7 December 2023, members of the 'National Task Force of Victims of Jeonse Rental Fraud' and 'Civil Society Task Force to Resolve Jeonse Rental Fraud' held a press conference and picketed in front of the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They denounced the government for coming up with unrealistic measures to assist victims of housing rental scams ('jeonse scams') and urged the authorities to revise the special bill to help victims with adequate support.

assoc_actor_1: KCTU: Korean Confederation of Trade Unions; Labor Group (South Korea)
notes: On 7 December 2023, members of the School Irregular Worker's Union (KCTU affiliate) Gyeonggi branch held a press conference with banners in front of the Gyeonggi Provincial Office of Education (Suwon). They condemned the education authorities for obstructing the establishment of a memorial altar for a late school meal worker who recently died of lung cancer, saying authorities need to discuss the measures to prevent industrial accident deaths of school cafeteria workers.

assoc_actor_1: KFEM: Korea Federation for Environmental Movement
notes: On 7 December 2023, members of 30 civic groups, including the Sancheong Progress Union and Jinju Korea Federation for Environmental Movement (KFEM), held a press conference with a banner in front of the Sancheong-gun Office (Oksan-ri, Sancheong-eup, Sancheong-gun), opposing the creation of Deoksan Dam due to the potential damage to the environment of Jirisan Mountain.

On 7 December 2023, members of civic groups in Jinju held a press conference with a banner at the Jinju City Hall (Jinju), urging the authorities to convert water-meter readers into permanent positions following the Supreme Court ruling.

assoc_actor_1: Government of South Korea (2022-); DPK: Democratic Party of Korea
notes: On 7 December 2023, DPK-affiliated city council members in Changwon held a press conference with a banner at the Changwon City Hall (Changwon), urging the mayor to stop the excessive use of 'unjust' personnel rights.

assoc_actor_1: KCTU: Korean Confederation of Trade Unions; Labor Group (South Korea)
notes: On 7 December 2023, members of the Parcel Delivery Workers' Solidarity Union (KCTU affiliate) held a press conference with banners in front of the Coupang Logistics Services (CLS) (Seoul City - Gangnam). They condemned Coupang CLS for planning to cut the agency fee, which would lead to a salary cut for delivery workers. They demanded the withdrawal of the plan.

On 7 December 2023, Hampyeong residents staged a protest in front of the Supreme Prosecutor's Office (Seoul City - Seocho), urging the authorities to arrest and investigate the Hampyeong county governor suspected of the alleged bribery. They also demanded the inspection of the Mokpo prosecutor's office for dereliction of duties as they have not made progress on the case for over a year.

On 7 December 2023, residents of Wanju county held a press conference with a banner at the Jeollabuk-do Provincial Council (Jeonju), opposing the redistricting draft for the upcoming election that combined Wanju county with Gimje city and Imsil county as one electoral district.

assoc_actor_1: Government of South Korea (2022-); DPK: Democratic Party of Korea
notes: On 7 December 2023, lawmakers and members of the DPK Euljiro Committee held a press conference and picketed at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the legislators to pass a bill to strengthen the bargaining power of merchants, agencies, small business owners, and small and medium-sized enterprises.

On 7 December 2023, members of education civic groups, including World Without Worries About Private Education, held a press conference with banners in front of Government Complex Seoul (Seoul City - Jongno), urging the government to reflect the change of requirements in the 2028 college entrance reform plan.

On 7 December 2023, residents of Jung-gu, Daegu, staged a protest in front of the Daegu Metropolitan Office of Education (Daegu - Suseong), opposing licensing the operation of a hotel nightclub near a school zone.

On 7 December 2023, about 100 kindergarten teachers in Jeju affiliated with the Jeju Early Childhood School Solidarity held a protest in front of the Jeju Special Self-Governing Provincial Office of Education (Jeju), opposing the government's plan to integrate early childhood education and childcare systems without social consensus.

On 7 December 2023, over 30 Buddhist monks and youths marched from Kampong Thom province to Odongk, Kampong Speu to call upon the government to ensure dignity, freedom, and justice for all citizens. The group planned to join a large-scale International Human Rights Day gathering in Phnom Penh on December 10.

On 7 December 2023, about 70 members of local autonomous civic groups held a press conference with a banner in front of the Incheon Jung-gu Office (Incheon - Jung). They urged the authorities to stop privatizing the Incheon Art Platform for the cultural rights of local people and artists.

On 7 December 2023, people protested outside the Premier's city office in Brisbane - Central, Queensland, against the Gabba redevelopment project. They claimed that the government should prioritize considerations related to the cost of living. The Australian Greens organized the event.

On 7 December 2023, climate protesters, including Extinction Rebellion members, marched through the CBD in Melbourne - Central, Victoria, advocating for decisive climate action. The protesters sprayed a government building.

On 7 December 2023, hundreds of students marched from Flinders Street station to Treasury Gardens in Melbourne - Central, Victoria, to express solidarity with Palestine. They called on Israel to stop its attack on Gaza. It was part of the School Strike for Palestine. On the same day, people in kayaks protested under the West Gate Bridge, blocking the path of boats trying to leave the port of Melbourne.

On 7 December 2023, around 100 fishers chased a fishing boat equipped with a tiger trawl net in Pusungkapal water, Seuruway district (Aceh Tamiang regency, Aceh province) (coded as Coast of Seuruway). They opposed the boat's activities due to environmental concerns. They confiscated the boat.
On 7 December 2023, thousands of laborers peacefully protested in front of the KP3B area in Curug district, Serang city (Banten province). They demanded an increase in the 2024 minimum wage.

On 7 December 2023, dozens of students from the Pro-Democracy Alliance peacefully protested in front of the city hall in Malang city (East Java province). They opposed the 'political dynasty' built by the current president.

On 7 December 2023, around 40 people from the Suku Anak Dalam tribe peacefully protested in front of the Tebo prison and regent's office in Central Tebo district (Tebo regency, Jambi province). They opposed the arrest of a tribe member for a rape accusation. They claimed he was innocent.

Around 7 December 2023 (as reported), a group of people from Batu Merah peacefully protested in Ambon city (Maluku province). They opposed the appointment of their new village head. They favored another candidate. They blocked the road with movable barriers.

On 7 December 2023, members of the 'Student Youth Volunteer Association for People Living in Palestine,' Palestinians from Gaza, and a writer, held a press conference inside the Diet in Tokyo - Chiyoda, Tokyo, calling on Israel to stop its attacks on Gaza. They claimed that Israel commits 'genocide' and 'ethnic cleansing.' One of the protesters held a Palestinian flag.
On 7 December 2023, people, including members of the BDS, protested at Shibuya station in Tokyo - Shibuya to express solidarity with Palestine.

On 7 December 2023, plaintiffs and lawyers involved in a lawsuit marched around the Tachikawa Branch of Tokyo District Court in Tachikawa, Tokyo, advocating for a noiseless atmosphere. The lawsuit is called 'Third New Yokota Air Base Pollution Lawsuit,' in which residents living near the U.S. Yokota Air Base demanded that the government prohibit flights of the CV-22 Osprey, a U.S. military transport aircraft, among other things.
On 7 December 2023, a dozen members of the Restore Passenger Rail gathered at a Council meeting in Auckland - Auckland against inequality and climate change.

On 7 December 2023, several hundred members of Destiny Church and supporters gathered on the front lawn of the Parliament in Wellington - Wellington in support of Israel amid the Israel-Hamas war. The protesters urged the New Zealand Foreign Minister not to call for a ceasefire. At the same time, pro-Palestine supporters organized a counter-protest at the Supreme Court in Wellington - Wellington demanding for a ceasefire in Gaza and expressing support for Palestine. The protest was planned by the Poneke Anti-Fascist Coalition.

The first attack occurred near Barangay Dalgan, and the subsequent attacks happened in a marshland near Kabacan and M'lang towns (Cotabato, Soccsksargen) (coded separately). About a hundred families fled to safer grounds. 9 fatalities were divided among the two events (5 fatalities coded for this event).

On 7 December 2023, a barangay chairwoman was killed by unidentified assailants in Barangay Tebag (Mangaldan, Pangasinan, Ilocos Region). The motive for the attack was unclear.

notes: Security measures: On 7 December 2023, during the Athens visit of Turkish President Erdogan for the 5th Greece-Turkey High Level Cooperation Council (the first of its kind in 7 years, following an extremely tense period in bilateral relations), there was heightened security across Athens with the deployment of 3,500 police officers, drones, traffic restrictions/road closures (also affecting public transport including metro, buses and trolleys) and special anti-terrorism unit EKAM snipers along the route of the motorcade. The National Intelligence Service (EYP) and all state security bodies were on alert. All public open-air gatherings were prohibited from 6 am until 6 pm.

On 7 December 2023, the leaders of Greece and Turkey signed the 'Athens Declaration on Friendly Relations and Good-Neighborliness', a joint declaration aiming to mend ties between the two countries, following years of strained relations that had raised tensions at alarming levels. The declaration - consisting of fifteen declarations, agreements and memoranda of cooperation concerning a wide range of sectors, from tourism, energy and trade to research, education and transport - was signed during President Erdogan's landmark visit to Athens for the 5th Greece-Turkey High Level Cooperation Council; it was historically significant because both parties clearly stated their commitment to the peaceful resolution of outstanding differences, on the basis of international law and the United Nations Charter, following intensive negotiations between the Greek and Turkish foreign ministries.

Protesters became aware of the presence of two undercover police officers and took them to Renamo premises for interrogation, leading to the assault of Renamo premises by special police forces (coded separately).

The driver was not injured, but his vehicle was hit at least twice. The Biobio region frequently experiences attacks from Indigenous militias demanding land restitution from forestry companies.

On 6 December 2023, in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, two armed individuals aboard a motorcycle shot against a house in Fraccionamiento Los Reyes. The motive of the attack seems to be related with drug selling.

Around 6 December 2023 (as reported), in Salinas Victoria, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and the body was found burned and with gunshots to the man's head on the side of the highway to Colombia. 1 fatality.

On 6 December 2023, in Timon (Maranhao), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Parque Piaui neighbourhood. The suspects were on a motorcycle and shot against the victim, who was sitting outside his residence with a friend. The suspects escaped. The victim's family claims that he had received threats from a drug trafficking gang, but it's unclear if the threats are connected to the attack. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Germany (2021-); Ver.di: United Services Union; Labor Group (Germany); GEW: German Education Union; Teachers (Germany)

On 6 December 2023, nearly 100 people, including staff of the Paul Sabatier University (including teaching staff) and elected representatives, staged a demonstration in Toulouse (Occitanie), to defend the cause of the hundred or so unaccompanied minors from African countries who have been sheltering for a year in a former biology building at the '4R3' university.

On 6 December 2023, Extinction Rebellion activists protested outside the Polytechnic in Torino (Piemonte) to demand an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, peace and freedom for Palestine, and more climate action.

On 6 December 2023, hundreds of people, university students, activists, representatives of CUA, and the self-managed social center Plat took to the streets of Bologna (Emilia-Romagna) to demonstrate against the eviction of two occupied buildings carried out by the police earlier on the same day. On 6 December 2023, about 100 students protested outside the provincial headquarters in La Spezia (Liguria) against the state of decay of the regional school buildings and the cold classrooms.

On 6 December 2023, residents of Daeyeon-dong, Busan, held a protest in front of the Busan Metropolitan City Hall (Busan - Yeonje), opposing the government's plan to create a rental housing district in their neighborhood without residents' consent.

Yogyakarta has a special status as a region and has been governed by the Yogyakarta Sultanate since 1950.

On 6 December 2023, a group of students held a demonstration in front of the Southeast Sulawesi University in Kendari city (Southeast Sulawesi province). They opposed the 'political dynasty' built by the current president. The head of the Student Executive Body asked them to disperse as the event did not have a permit. The demonstrators beat him up. There was no detail regarding the injuries.

On 6 December 2023, members of the Abashiri branch of Hokkaido Peace Action Forum and 'Peace Wishes from Abashiri' protested in front of Road Station Ryuhyo-kaido Abashiri in Abashiri, Hokkaido, calling for an immediate halt to the Israeli invasion of Gaza. They also opposed war in general.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Japan); Labor Group (Japan); Students (Japan); Protesters (United Kingdom); Teachers (United Kingdom); Former Government of Japan (2012-); JCP: Japanese Communist Party
notes: On 6 December 2023, people, including members of the Tokai University Teachers Union, Tokai University Sagami Teachers Association, Sapporo District Labor Federation, Shizuoka Prefecture Council of Labor Unions, and General Federation of Trade Unions of Yamanashi Prefecture, students, and a British lecturer who was hired out of the university, protested in front of the Tokai University Shonan Campus in Hiratsuka, Kanagawa, to advocate for an increase in wages for Tokai University professors. A former member of the House of Representatives from the JCP attended the event.

On 6 December 2023, people, including members of the Anti-War Committee Of 1000, protested in front of the Israeli embassy in Tokyo - Chiyoda against the Israeli attack on Gaza. They also called for the freedom of the Gaza people and an immediate ceasefire in the armed conflict. The Peace in Palestine! Emergency Action organized the event.

On 6 December 2023, people protested in front of the Shinjuku Bus Terminal in Tokyo - Shinjuku against hate speech targeting transgender people. A group of counter-protesters demonstrated against transgender people being allowed to enter women's restrooms.

On 6 December 2023, groups of villagers (likely from Kalasa and Kip, based on the history of rivalry in the area) clashed at Sialum LLG (coded at Gitua), Morobe, resulting in the death of 2 men. This followed three reprisal killings on 28 and 29 November 2023.

assoc_actor_2: Kapore Block Communal Group (Papua New Guinea)
notes: On 6 December 2023, Mai villagers and Kapore Block settlers clashed at Kapore Block, Gaopore (West New Britain) resulting in 4 injured men and several houses torched. Road blocks were also erected along the Hoskins Highway. This followed an incident on 5 December 2023 where Kapore Block youths chased Mai villagers from Kapore for collecting sago palm leaves for traditional roofing (coded separately).

source: Manila Bulletin; Philippine Star; Rappler; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 6 December 2023, a farmer accused by the military of being an NPA militant (red-tagged) was killed by the military in Barangay Amontay (Binalbagan, Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). The military reported that a firefight occurred between the NPA and the military. The wife of the farmer refuted the military's claim, saying that her husband was not an NPA militant but rather a chainsaw operator and a farmer. She said that the military visited their house and talked to his husband at the back of the house, where they killed him. She said the NPA would pass through their community, and they would provide them with food to prevent repercussions for not allowing them into their houses.
On 6 December 2023, pro-Palestine supporters demonstrated in Apia (Tuamasaga), calling for the Samoan government to support a ceasefire.

On 6 December 2023, people blocked the entrance to a Danish defense and aerospace company's factory in Soborg, Hovedstaden, to oppose the company's delivery of weapons and jet parts to Israel.
On 6 December 2023, around 100 people demonstrated in Aarhus to raise awareness of the child victims of the ongoing Israeli offensive in Gaza.

On 6 December 2023, around 10 people demonstrated during a service at the Helsinki Cathedral to show their support and solidarity with the people of Palestine. Later, the police removed the activists from the site.

On 6 December 2023, more than 1000 people, including activists from the Helsinki Without Nazis movement, gathered in Toolontori, Helsinki, in connection with the Finnish Independence Day and the planned '612 March for Freedom'. The police dispersed the demonstration and at least 54 people were detained on suspicion of violating the assembly rules.

On 6 December 2023, the parents of an elementary school in the Chaska neighborhood of Skopje protested against the opening of an Albanian-language classroom in the school, which they claim does not reflect the ethnic structure of the neighborhood. assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 6 December 2023, on the 15th anniversary of the killing of teenager Alexandros Grigoropoulos by a police special guard in Exarchia, police made pre-emptive arrests remanding 47 people for questioning during pre-emptive searches in Athens - Central Athens, amid concerns of violence breaking out at rallies and marches.

On 6 December 2023, in the morning, on the 15th anniversary of the killing of a teenager by a police special guard in Exarchia, over 700 school and university students marched to parliament on Syntagma square in Athens - Central Athens. During the march, unidentified individuals (likely far-left) vandalized the Omonia metro station's ticket booths.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 6 December 2023, in the evening, on the 15th anniversary of the killing of a teenager by a police special guard in Exarchia, about 9,000 demonstrators organized by anarchist and leftist collectives of the wider anti-establishment sector marched in Athens - Central Athens. Extraordinary traffic regulations were put in place on various central roads and 2 metro stations were closed down. At least 4,000 officers were deployed from all law enforcement, security and traffic services. Security was particularly increased in Exarchia. At the end of the demonstrations, rioters damaged shop windows, set fire to garbage bins and set up roadblocks. In Exarchia, they hurled various objects at police, who responded with tear gas. There were 128 detentions, 14 of which turned into arrests. There were reports of MAT riot police pushing and targeting journalists and photo-reporters, who were covering the news about demonstrators being trapped in an apartment block as they were hiding from police; the latter smashed glass entrance door to reach the demonstrators.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 6 December 2023, in the evening, on the 15th anniversary of the killing of a teenager by a police special guard in Exarchia, about 4,500 members of the extra-parliamentary left and the wider anti-establishment sector marched in Thessaloniki. They split in 2 marches with the students and leftists ending up at the Ministry of Macedonia and Thrace and the anarchists marching in central streets. Police set up a roadblock and used water cannon near the university campus. Rioters hurled petrol bombs and set fire to garbage bins. Police used tear gas. There were 35 detentions, 16 of which (2 of them minors, in total 12 men and 4 women) turned into arrests. Other demonstrators hurled petrol bombs at the MAT riot police unit stationed outside the Turkish consulate.

On 6 December 2023, at noon, on the 15th anniversary of the killing of a teenager by a police special guard in Exarchia, school and university students and collectives of the anti-establishment sector marched to the Ministry of Macedonia and Thrace in Thessaloniki. The protesters were shouting slogans against the police.

On 6 December 2023, more than 1,500 taxi drivers, supported by their union SATA, participated in a motorcade in Athens - Central Athens on the second day of their strike against the government's proposed tax reforms.

On 6 December 2023, local people gathered under the banner of a five-member committee, led by the Block education officer, and staged a protest and locked the gates of a government school in Guhla village (Kaithal, Haryana) against the school's principal for sexually harassing more than four girls. The accused principal was arrested.

On 6 December 2023, nursing staff staged a sit-in protest, carrying placards, at the All India Institute Of Medical Science (AIIMS) in Bathinda city (Punjab) against the failure of the state government to fulfill their demands which included promotions and 8 holidays per month. On 6 December 2023, members of the Tamil Nadu Government Doctors' Association (TNGDA) staged a protest and boycotted their duties at the Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) in Madurai city (Tamil Nadu) demanding security for doctors after a postgraduate medical student was attacked by a man in an inebriated condition (coded separately).
