assoc_actor_1: PT: Workers' Party; PL: Liberal Party; UP: Popular Unity (Brazil); Labor Group (Brazil); Students (Brazil)
actor2: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Brasil de Fato; G1; Ponte Jornalismo
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Sao Paulo - South Zone (Sao Paulo), thousands of people gathered in Sao Paulo's legislative assembly to demonstrate against the privatization of the basic sanitation company, Sabesp, currently under discussion by the state deputies. Workers' unions and students were among the demonstrators. Two members of the UP party were arrested. Deputies from PT and PL parties also shoved each other. The police intervened and used pepper spray and batons against the demonstrators.

On 5 December 2023, in Alerce (Los Lagos), residents of the La Colonia de Alerce neighborhood set tires on fire on the main road to demonstrate over a shortage of drinking water. Residents went without their usual water deliveries for over a fortnight when investigations began into potential favouritism, and deliveries over the past several days had only been partial. Demonstrators stated that some locals had resorted to drinking rainwater.

On 5 December 2023, in Valdivia (Los Rios), relatives of prisoners held in the city's prison protested outside the building over prison guards' abusive behavior. Protesters, who also mobilized the following day, claimed that a prisoner had been beaten and that their rights to visits and to take in food were being violated.

actor1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Property destruction: On 5 December 2023, in the rural area of Altamira municipality (Huila), FARC dissidents forced the driver and passengers of a bus of the Coomotor company to get out of the vehicle and then proceeded to set it on fire in El Grifo vereda. The incident was related to the non-payment of extortion money.

Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), in Arjona (Bolivar), a group of citizens beat up a man who was being arrested by police forces after being accused of committing a rape. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), around 200 residents in the Patio Bonito neighborhood demonstrated to repudiate the release of a man who had raped a girl when she was going back home from school from prison. The demonstrators set garbage cans on fire and clashed with UNDMO officers. Two officers were injured.

actor2: FARC Dissident - 36th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (36th Front - Jair Aldana Baquero)
notes: On 5 December 2023, in the rural area of Briceno municipality (Antioquia), Gulf Clan members clashed with FARC dissidents (likely 36th Front, given recent clashes in the area). Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Calarca (Quindio), unidentified armed individuals killed a former FARC member in the Y sector. The victim was traveling in a vehicle from Ibague to Cali and had been a victim of another attack days before in Florencia, Caqueta, which he survived. There is presence of the Gulf Clan and other criminal gangs in the area. 1 fatality.
Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), in El Charco municipality (Narino), there was a clash between unidentified armed groups. Casualties unknown.

On 5 December 2023, in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), a group of women and other protesters marched through the streets of Kennedy to the local mayor's office, demanding the eradication of all forms of violence against women as part of a series of protests in the context of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, commemorated on 25 November.

On 5 December 2023, in La Mesa (Cundinamarca), residents blocked the highway setting tires on fire to demonstrate against the installation of parking meters in town. They said that they would increase their cost of living and affect the circulation of vehicles. They also said that there was no consultation with the community about the installation.
On 5 December 2023, in Bogota - Los Martires (Bogota, D.C.), a group of people staged demonstrations at the Ricaurte CAI. There is no further information about the reasons behind the demonstration.

On 5 December 2023, in Medellin - Central East (Antioquia), dozens of health and administrative workers from the General Hospital of Medellin marched to the Alpujarra Square to protest against the lack of supplies and medications, mismanagement of resources, and delays in salary payments to the institution's employees.

On 5 December 2023, in Pasacaballos (Bolivar), a group of residents from the Bajo del Tigre and Concordia veredas blocked the Pasacaballos-Baru road to protest the poor condition of the elevated tank that supplies them with water. They claim that it might collapse due to erosion and lack of maintenance, posing a risk to the community.

On 5 December 2023, in Riohacha (La Guajira), a group of organizers of the carnival in Riohacha blocked the entrance to the municipal Mayor's Office to demand the payment of 50% of the budget allocated to them for 2023 and claimed that there is a debt to be paid by the municipal administration since March 2023.

On 5 December 2023, in Sincelejo (Sucre), workers at the Victor Guevara Child Development Center (CDI) protested outside the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare (ICBF) against administrative and logistic problems with the Prosperar Corozal operator. They said that these issued are causing delays in the delivery of food to children.

On 5 December 2023, between Uribia and Manaure municipalities (coded to Uribia, La Guajira), members of the Wayuu Indigenous community blocked a thermoelectric plant to demand to the Promigas company the payment of compensation for the use of their land for the natural gas supply. They claim there was no previous consultation with the community.

On 5 December 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), military and police forces captured 10 members of Los Tiguerones gang in the Estero Nadazero sector, including the leader of the gang. Los Tiguerones are part of Los Lobos gang, which are also part of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) of Mexico.

On 5 December 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), workers at the local government burned tires on the streets around the local government as a demonstration to demand payment of their salaries and contributions to the social security.

On 5 December 2023, in Pelileo (Tungurahua), residents and family members of a police officer that was killed during a raid staged a demonstration to demand justice and repudiating the presence of foreigners living in the city.

On 5 December 2023, in Puerto Nuevo (Esmeraldas), residents and farmers of Muisne district blocked the Y de Salango - Chamanga highway as a demonstration to demand maintenance of rural streets and the Muisne - Chamanga highway that has been affected by the winter season.

On 5 December 2023, in Arequipa (Arequipa), parents of students at Paulo Fraide school, located in Apipa sector Cerro Colorado District, staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to demand the construction of the school infrastructure that has been pending for 8 years.

On 5 December 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), residents of 31 de Octubre, General Cordova and Raymondi avenues, and of Huari and Huancan sectors staged a demonstration to demand potable water supply that has been lacking for more than eleven days.

On 5 December 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), Maynas province teachers blocked the street in front of the Loreto Regional Education Management (GREL) with burning tires as a demonstration to demand payment of their salaries for the previous month that is still pending.

On 5 December 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), hundreds of residents marched around San Martin square as a demonstration to repudiate the release of former president Alberto Fujimori, who was released after the Constitutional Tribunal decided on his release.

On 5 December 2023, in Lima - Los Olivos (Lima), parents of students at Trilce school staged a demonstration to demand the resignation of the dean of the school due to not paying attention to cases of bullying in the school. The demonstration was held due to a student being bullied and sexually assaulted by other students inside the school.

On 5 December 2023, in Piura (Piura), Venezuelan residents, family members and friends of a Venezuelan woman who was killed by a police officer days prior marched to the Justice Court as a demonstration to demand a faster investigation and justice in the case, and the arrest of the police officer responsible.

On 5 December 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), residents burned a motorcycle cab that was used by five men that were accused of being robbers in Pampa Hermosa human settlement, in San Juan Bautista district. They had captured three of the men, but before they could punish them they were taken by police officers.

On 5 December 2023, in Santo Tomas (Loreto), residents blocked the highway that enters the city with burning tires as a demonstration to demand the regional government infrastructure repairs to be carried out in the health center.

Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), in Parramos municipality, Chimaltenango, a man was killed and his dismembered body was left in an empty lot on the road to San Pedro Yepocapa. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Frecineau, Artibonite, an unknown number of armed men in vehicles shot and killed a person and kidnapped four other civilians in the Village Mac Donald road. There is no further information on the perpetrators, although latest report suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, residents, trade unions, and business people, among others, held a march with banners along the National Road 1 against gang insecurity and to demand an intervention by the state authorities to restore peace in the Artibonite department. The mobilization was called by the Dialogue, Reconciliation, and Awareness Commission to Save the Artibonite.
On 5 December 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals kidnapped a lawyer at his residence, in La Tremblay neighbourhood. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 5 December 2023, in Mariani, Ouest, gang members shot and killed a truck driver as they opened fire on his vehicle on the National Road 2, where the criminals had installed a toll booth. Another driver was injured during the shooting. According to police, the gangsters threw Molotov cocktails against vehicles circulating along the roadway. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 5 December 2023, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, two unknown individuals shot at the truck of the Deputy Minister of Security while she was driving in the America neighborhood. The bullets hit the vehicle, but the victim remained unharmed given that the vehicle was armored. The official recalled that she had received intimidation in recent weeks, which increased following a complaint she made where shell casings from the National Police were discovered in the massacre of 46 female inmates in the National Women's Penitentiary for Social Adaptation (PNFAS) in Tamara. There were no casualties.

On 5 December 2023, in Kingston, Kingston, a group of heavily armed men exited a vehicle, entered the Michael Manley Market on Pine Street (Dunkirk section, a.k.a. McIntyre Villa) and shot indiscriminately against people inside, killing a man and injuring at least six civilians, including a baby. According to witnesses, the shooters fled the scene in a black motor car. The motivation for the mass shooting is unknown. 1 fatality, 6 injured.

On 5 December 2023, in Priory, Saint Ann, an unknown number of armed individuals in a motor car shot and killed a woman and injured another one when they were on the roadway (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 5 December 2023, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, in the morning, residents held a protest to decry the Saint John's road deplorable conditions. Protesters blocked the roadway as they demanded the authorities to fix it. Road traffic was diverted due to the mobilization.

On 5 December 2023, in La Paz, Baja California, friends and family of a victim of femicide protested to demand authorities to give the accused perpetrator maximum penalty. Protesters demanded justice.

On 5 December 2023, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, students from the Mactumatza normal rural school demonstrated to demand the definitive cancellation of investigation files against students arrested during a protest in May 2021 (coded separately). Demonstrators demanded the establishment of a dialogue table with the state government.

On 5 December 2023, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, members of the Mothers' Collective of Femicide Victims protested at Congress to demand speedier searches from authorities for femicide victims. Protesters sprayed graffiti and placed pictures of their missing relatives to demand solutions.

On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, bus drivers protested and blocked roads to demand the permission to operate. Protesters refused to join concessionaires after the new route was opened.

assoc_actor_1: CNTE: National Coordination of Education Workers; Teachers (Mexico); SNTE: National Union of Education Workers
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, about 100 teachers and members of the CNTE and SNTE demonstrated to demand salary leveling and salary increases. Demonstrators marched to the Secretary of Public Education (SEP) demanded to speak to the head of the SEP. The group of teachers broke into the SEP and attempted to break down the fence. There were reports of physical assaults against police officers and employees of the SEP.

On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, workers protested outside the Attorney General's office to demand the location of a missing employee and demanded an investigation of an employee accused of sexual harassment and abuse.

On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, taxi drivers from the site 300 protested near the Attorney General's office to demand the resolution of their complaints filed months before for fraud. Protesters accused their leader of corruption.

On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, parents and former students of the Trilingual Central University Santa Maria la Ribera protested at the Chamber of Deputies to request an intervention of the federal government for fraud. Protesters denounced the lack of issuing of certificates and professional degrees to its graduates.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero, street vendors protested and blocked an avenue against their recent displacement from their workspaces. Protesters demanded solutions so that vendors can return to work.

source: El Siglo de Durango; El Universal (Mexico)
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, several armed individuals shot at police officers in colonia Santa Maria Aztahuacan, who came to the area after reports of shots fired due to a fight, the officers repelled the attack. Four people were captured, three were injured, and one was killed. 1 fatality, 3 injured.

On 5 December 2023, in Torreon, Coahuila de Zaragoza, drivers of material trucks protested at the entrance to the city at the height of Puerta Amarilla to demand more security measures after one driver was robbed, beaten and kidnapped the week before.

On 5 December 2023, in Torreon, Coahuila de Zaragoza, residents protested outside the National Water Commission (Conagua) to denounce false documents and signatures that the institution acquired for benefits of land and water.

On 5 December 2023, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, teachers deserving of the federal scholarship called Performance Stimulus for Teaching Staff (Esdeped) protested outside the Rector's office to demand the payment of scholarships. Protesters denounced the lack of payments and demanded immediate solutions.

On 5 December 2023, in Celaya, Guanajuato, some 500 students of the Latina University of Mexico protested to demand justice for the death of five students and to demand the State Attorney General's office to arrest those responsible for the death.
On 5 December 2023, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a couple of individuals opened fire at a man and killed him outside a grocery store in Colonia Los Limones. 1 fatality.
On 5 December 2023, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, relatives and friends protested at the Tlacopanocha beach to demand justice for a man who went missing five years earlier.
On 5 December 2023, in Tierra Colorada, Guerrero, unknown armed individuals opened fire and killed the Public Prosecutor of Juan R. Escudero municipality in Colonia San Jose. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, close to Chichihualco, Guerrero, armed individuals set up roadblocks close to Jalapa and El Palmar with logs and rocks. The individuals also destroyed the infrastructure to cut off electricity, cellphone networks and internet signals.
Around 5 December 2023, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, a man was killed and his body was found covered in cardboard and with his hands and feet tied close to La Minerva traffic circle. 1 fatality.
On 5 December 2023, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals opened fire at the facade of a home in Colonia Generalisimo Morelos. There were no casualties.

admin2: Heroica Ciudad de Juchitan de Zaragoza
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Juchitan de Zaragoza, Oaxaca, a group of people closed traffic and set up a roadblock. The event is being linked to Normalist students. There is no information on the motivation for the demonstration.

On 5 December 2023, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, members of the Section 13 of the Independent Union of Workers of the Institute of Security and Social Services of State Workers (ISSSTE) protested during a press conference and demanded the immediate dismissal of the official accused of labor harassment and sexual harassment, among other.

On 5 December 2023, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, a group of hooded men took over offices, hijacked a bus and set up roadblocks in Colonia Reforma. The event is being linked to Normalist students. There is no information on the motivation for the demonstration.

On 5 December 2023, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, a group of residents of Colonia La Joya blocked the road to Etla against a garbage dump installed since 2 December. Protesters denounced the infections caused by the dump and demanded its immediate removal.
Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), in Santa Catarina, Puebla, a woman was killed and her body was found wrapped in plastic and blankets and decapitated. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Santiago de Queretaro, Queretaro, former workers of a factory protested to demand their severance payments after they were dismissed. Protesters blocked access to the industrial park to demand their payment and support from the state governor.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
notes: On 5 December 2023, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, members of an organized crime group opened fire at ministerial police officers who repelled the aggression. One police officer died as a result while one armed individual was injured. After reinforcement joined, five armed individuals were arrested. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

On 5 December 2023, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, students of the UAS law faculty protested to demand the reinstatement of a professor. Five protesters climbed onto the roof of the faculty to demand the intervention of authorities and the return of their teacher.

On 5 December 2023, in El Walamo, Sinaloa, residents captured a man accused of stealing a motorcycle and beat him in an attempted lynching. He was handcuffed, tied hand and foot, and tied to a light post with ropes. Police officers arrived later.

On 5 December 2023, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, parents protested and took over the office of the Ministry of Public Education and Culture to demand urgent attention after a kindergarten was closed for more than 16 days. Protesters demanded solutions to the lack of teachers at the kindergarten.

On 5 December 2023, in Hermosillo, Sonora, for a second consecutive day, former daycare teachers staged a sit-in outside the Victim's Attention office to demand federal authorities to recognize them as victims and access to a lifetime pension for physical and psychological injuries. The teachers worked in a daycare that burned down in 2009.

On 5 December 2023, in Hermosillo, Sonora, members of the Sonora River Basin Committees (CCRS) protested outside the government palace to denounce the lack of medical attention after the toxic spill. Protesters demanded solutions and denounced Health authorities for their lack of solutions.

On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, armed individuals in two vehicles intercepted a man driving on the highway Victoria-Matamoros in an attempted kidnapping. When the driver did not stop, the armed individuals opened fire at him and chased him. The man escaped the scene and was not injured.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Acayucan, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, armed individuals opened fire at the facade of a home and a restaurant. There were no casualties.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 December 2023, in General Miguel Aleman, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, parents took over a school to demand solutions to lack of electricity and to demand the immediate hiring of a school janitor.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Cordoba, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, parents took over a school in Colonia Nuevo Tuxpan to demand solutions to lack of electricity and to demand the immediate hiring of a school janitor.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Cotaxtla, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested at the river bridge to demand the completion of paving roads. Protesters blocked access to the municipality to demand solutions to unfinished work and to demand doctors in the town of Mata Tejon.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 December 2023, in La Perla, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, one armed man opened fire at police officers on surveillance. One man was arrested and two escaped the scene. There were no casualties.

source: El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
notes: On 5 December 2023, near Guayama (coded to Guayama), Guayama, security forces arrested the two leaders of Los Popcorn Gang as they carried out a security operation in several locations in the South of the island. Several other members of the organization were also arrested. The gang leaders were brothers. They were accused of drug-trafficking, among other crimes.

source: Loop News Trinidad and Tobago; Newsday Trinidad and Tobago; Trinidad and Tobago Guardian
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Diego Martin, Diego Martin, two armed men dressed in camouflage clothes exited a vehicle and opened fire on a couple who were inside a vehicle next to a shopping centre, in Diamond Vale. A man at the driver's seat was killed and a woman at the passenger's front seat was injured. Another version stated that the shooters blocked the victims' march and shot from their vehicle (drive-by). The attack could be gang-related. The deceased's mother claimed that he was not involved in any criminal activity, but he could have been targeted in relation to the killing of a man a year before (uncoded). The shooters fled the scene in the vehicle. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 5 December 2023, in Maraval, Diego Martin, overnight, two armed men opened fire on a group of people standing along the Saddle Road, injuring one of them. The motivation for the attack is unknown. The perpetrators fled the scene in a vehicle. 1 injured.

source: Loop News Trinidad and Tobago; Trinidad and Tobago Guardian
notes: Around 5 December 2023 (between 5 - 6 December), in Port of Spain, Port of Spain, overnight, an unknown number of armed men in a vehicle shot at a man walking along Observatory Street, injuring him (drive-by). The shooters fled the scene. Motivation unknown. 1 injured.
On 5 December 2023, in Mendoza (Capital, Mendoza), court workers protested in front of the Palace of Justice to demand the opening of negotiations for salary improvements in the context of inflation.

On 5 December 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), residents in the Novo Aleixo neighborhood beat up and severely injured two people they suspected were robbers. The pair was taken to a hospital by emergency responders. There were no fatalities

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), members of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police in the Raio de Sol community, Nova Cidade neighborhood. The drug traffickers escaped. There were no fatalities.

source: Folha do Estado da Bahia; Portal Chico Sabe Tudo
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Feira X neighbourhood. The suspects shot the victim multiple times in the head inside a barber shop. The barber, who was working at the moment of the attack, was also shot and injured. Motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Folha do Estado da Bahia; Portal Chico Sabe Tudo
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the George Americo neighbourhood. The suspects shot the victim, who was in front of his residence, from a black vehicle. The suspects escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Salvador - Barra/Pituba (Bahia), military police officers exchanged fire with a BDM drug trafficker in the STIEP neighbourhood. The officers received reports about the presence of an armed man in the region, and a shoot out took place when the suspect was spotted. During the clash, the suspect was shot and killed. He was known as one of the BDM's drug trafficking leaders in the region. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, drugs and cash. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Salvador - Cajazeiras (Bahia), military police officers exchanged fire with an unidentified armed suspect in the Cajazeiras neighbourhood. During the clash, the suspect was shot and injured. There is no information about the suspect's health conditions. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Salvador - Tancredo Neves (Bahia), prison guards shot two suspected drug traffickers in the Mata Escura neighbourhood. The victims were trying to throw cellphones, and knives, and drugs inside a prison. The officers spotted the men and shot them. The victims were injured. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 5 December 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), armed individuals forced the bus driver and bus passengers out of a bus in the Aparecida neighborhood, and set the bus on fire. The attack was retaliation for the death of a man during a clash with police (coded separately).

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Cariacica (Espirito Santo), armed individuals exchanged fire with military police in the Quiabo community, Porto Novo neighborhood. One armed suspect was killed and another was injured and later arrested. Police seized firearms, ammunition and radio communicators. 1 fatality.
On 5 December 2023, in Confins (Minas Gerais), an unknown armed individual shot and killed a man in the Tavares neighborhood. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Belem (Para), residents of the Liberdade 2 housing complex, in the Terra Firme neighborhood, blocked the Almirante Barroso avenue to protest against issues in their housing complex.

On 5 December 2023, in Belem (Para), five members of a drug trafficking group stabbed, mutilated and killed a fellow gang member in a drug trafficking tribunal, under accusations of theft in the Outeiro area. 1 fatality.
On 5 December 2023, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), employees at a hospital carried out a protest against racism after an employee had a banana put in his working shoes.

On 5 December 2023, in Aracaju (Sergipe), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive by shooting in the Santos Dumont neighbourhood. The suspects escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), relatives of a man who died while assaulting a woman and her child gathered at the intersection of Puerto Rico and Carlos Maria Ramirez streets, blocking traffic and setting tires on fire, in rejection of the release of the person responsible for his death. They claim for justice in the case. The Police arrived at the scene to clear the road. Rioters threw stones at them, and police responded with non-lethal weapons.

On 5 December 2023, in El Tigre (Anzoategui), approximately 50 demonstrators, workers at the local Unicasa supermarket protested against their unannounced layoffs that day, and to demand immediate payment of owed stipends corresponding to their dismissal payouts. They gathered outside the local Unicasa supermarket.

Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), in Cagua (Aragua), four people, including two minors, were shot and killed, and their bodies found tied up, in the Bella Vista parish. The killings were thought to have taken place the night before in a forested area nearby, and motivated by disputes between rival gangs. A fifth person was killed and found close by, but it is unknown whether this killing is related to the initial four. There is no further information at this point in time. 5 fatalities.

source: Diario Primicia; El Diario de Guayana; VPItv
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Ciudad Guayana (Bolivar), a group of demonstrators, including university teachers at the Guayana National University (UNEG), the Antonio Jose de Sucre National Experimental University in Ciudad Guayana (UNEXPO), and the Oriente University (UDO), health workers, workers at companies belonging to the CVG, and representatives of the UNEG (APUNEG) and the UNEXPO workers' unions, protested to demand better pay and working conditions, and payment of owed stipends. They gathered in the Monumento a la CVG Square.

source: El Impulso; La Patilla; OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Barquisimeto (Lara), a group of students at the National Experimental Arts University in Barquisimeto (UNEARTE), protested against the dire conditions in which they receive classes, and to demand additional funding for the institution. They claim that the university lacks toilets, a canteen, and other facilities, and has no maintenance personnel. They gathered outside the Ombudsman Office.

source: El Pitazo; La Prensa de Lara
notes: On 5 December 2023, in La Puerta (Lara), a group of residents of the La Guadalupe sector blocked the Troncal 4 road in protest over power outages going on for at least a month, due to the breakdown of an electric transformer. They claim that these problems affect approximately 75 families, and demand action from the authorities.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Merida state (coded to Merida), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to housing, labor, education, healthcare, and justice.

On 5 December 2023, in San Cristobal (Tachira), a group of demonstrators, including active and retired teachers, and representatives of the Tachira state Unitary Teachers' Union (SUMA-ET), protested to demand better pay and working conditions, payment of owed stipends, and the restoration of their medical insurance plans (HCM). They gathered outside the San Cristobal Town hall, where they met with officials who admitted that the municipality cannot provide any pay rises due to budgetary problems; instead of these, the local authorities have suggested reducing their workweek to two days.

On 5 December 2023, in Maracaibo (Zulia), a group of cancer patients and their relatives protested to demand the medicines they need for their treatments, and better medical attention. They gathered outside the Alto Costo del Seguro Social Pharmacy, by the Adolfo Pons Hospital.
On 5 December 2023, local businessmen held a rally in front of the county governor's office in Bandar e Ganaveh (Bushehr) to protest against 'Te Lanji's bill' in the Iranian parliament.

source: Eteraze Bazar; Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA)
notes: On 5 December 2023, employees of Maragheh municipality held a protest rally in and outside the municipal hall in Maragheh city (East Azerbaijan) over their unmet demands.
On 5 December 2023, workers for the Abadan Petrochemical Plant protested in front of the county governor's office in Abadan city (Khuzestan) to demand payment of wage arrears.

source: Eteraze Bazar; Free Union of Iranian Workers; Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA)

Security measures: On 5 December 2023, Van Governor's office issued a ban on all forms of marches, protests, press conferences, sit-ins and other political gatherings in the province for 2 days in order to maintain public order and security. Similar measures have been imposed in the province (and several other southeastern provinces) for some years to maintain public order, presumably against political events that can be organized by Kurdish movements.

On 5 December 2023, Habar Gedir Ayr sub-clan militia and Marehan clan militia met in Balanbale village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud) agreed to co-exist peacefully, following a recent disputes over land and clan revenges in Galmudug (coded separately).

On 5 December 2023, ENDF conducted a drone strike against Fano at a place between Menz and the town of Merabite (location coded to Merhabete, North Shewa, Amhara), killing ten people including civilians. Additional three drone attacks were conducted at the same place, and it is unknown how many individuals are killed in these later drone attacks.

Around 5 December 2023 (between 4 December - 6 December), ENDF conducted a drone strike against Fano in a place near Wegeltena (Delanta, South Wello, Amhara), killing at least 10 individuals including civilians. Civilians were killed when the second-round drone attack was committed at the same place against people attempting to provide emergency services to Fano soldiers attacked by the first drone.
On 5 December 2023, SAF air-raids targeted RSF in Khartoum North - Kafouri (Bahri, Khartoum). Casualties unknown.

notes: On 5 December 2023, International forces (likely US forces) conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab position in Saakow town (Saakow, Middle Juba) and Bu'aale (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 5 December 2023, suspected Al Shabaab opened fire and overrun Liboi police station (Dadaab, Garissa) before being repulsed by police officers. None of the police was injured while unknown number of militants possibly sustained gunshot wounds. Police recovered an AK47 rifle, ten bullets and 19 spent cartridges.

On 5 December 2023, Al Shabaab attacked security forces (likely police officers, the most commonly-involved security forces) in Kutaayo village, also known as Kutayo (Mandera South, Mandera). Casualties unknown. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 5 December 2023, a local community in Yirol West county (likely to be Atout based on the county) attacked with spears and sticks security personnel (coded as SSPDF) who escorted surveyors at the outskirts of Yirol town (Yirol West, Lakes). The clash occurred over a disagreement on the establishment of a GPS coordinate for a new market on the outskirts of Yirol town. One SSPDF was killed, and three Atout sustained gunshot wounds.

notes: On 5 December 2023, ENDF clashed with OLF Shane in Chiro kebele, in Hidabu Abote woreda (location coded to Ejere, North Shewa, Oromia), resulting in unspecified number of civilian properties getting destroyed. Casualties unknown.

On 5 December 2023, gendarmerie officers exchanged fire with a dahalo group in Kianindrana near Ambatolampy (Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava) following an attack the night before (coded separately). The dahalo group escaped leaving the stolen zebus behind.

On 5 December 2023, SAF and RSF exchanged artillery shelling in Signal Corps base in Khartoum North - Kobar (Bahri, Khartoum), with SAF airstrikes being reported. Casualties unknown.

The market and large number of civilians houses were looted and burned. Civilians were displaced from the village. SPLM-N-Abdelaziz repelled RSF and forced them to withdraw to Debiebat.

On 5 December 2023, eight unidentified ethnic militia (described as bandits) engaged in an armed clash with three armed herders in Kangeta near Njia (Igembe Central, Meru). Two people were killed (1 herder and 1 militia), as the militia escaped with 79 heads of cattle towards Isiolo.

On 5 December 2023, suspected Al Shabaab slaughtered goats and chicken, before abducting, killing and dumping the body of a man outside his home in Poromoko village near Marafa (Lamu West, Lamu) (some sources mention that the County Commissioner refuted claims that it was Al Shabaab attack).

On 5 December 2023, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two Somali businesspeople in Rustenburg (Bojanala, North West). The event occurred in the context of xenophobic attacks and kidnappings targeting foreign business people.

assoc_actor_2: Government of South Africa (1994-); DA: Democratic Alliance
notes: On 5 December 2023, unidentified gunmen shot and killed the DA chief whip of the uMngeni Municipality in his home in Emasosheni near Mpophomeni (uMngeni, Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). The mayor of uMngeni received information that the murder was organized by someone involved in local politics, and the councilor had received threats a week prior to his killing. The councilor's wife and two children were at home during the attack but escaped unharmed.

On 5 December 2023, an unidentified individual shot and killed a private investigator in Benoni (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng). The investigator had been involved in the investigation of the Gold One Mine hostage situation in October (coded separately), and his killing is suspected to be linked to the findings from that investigation. At the time of the attack, the man was accompanied by his wife and two children, who managed to escape unharmed.

source: Al Sudani; Al Taghyeer (Sudan); Ayin Network; Darfur 24; Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; Twitter
notes: On 5 December 2023, RSF shot at the medical director of a hospital and a member of the emergency room and threatened them at Bashair hospitals in Khartoum - Al Azhari (Khartoum, Khartoum). The doctors then went on strike as result. There were no fatalities.
Movement of forces: On 5 December 2023, RSF deployed police and traffic police in 60 Street in Khartoum - Arkaweet (Khartoum, Khartoum).
Movement of forces: On 5 December 2023, RSF reinforcements arrived from Darfur to Omdurman (location coded to Omdurman - Abu Seid, Khartoum).

Movement of forces: Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), a 'large' number of militia (likely Salamat allied to RSF described as tribal and parties to the previous clashes between Salamat and Beni Halba) arrived at Kubum locality (location coded to Kubbum, Kubum, South Darfur) suspectedly in preparation for a resumption of fighting between Salamat and Beni Helba, who agreed to cease hostilities on 7 November (coded separately).

Movement of forces: Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), a 'large' number of militia (likely Beni Halba alied to RSF described as tribal and parties to the previous clashes between Salamat and Beni Halba) arrived at Kubum locality (location coded to Kubbum, Kubum, South Darfur) suspectedly in preparation for a resumption of fighting between Salamat and Beni Helba, who agreed to cease hostilities on 7 November (coded separately).

actor1: JEM-Gibiril Ibrahim: Justice and Equality Movement

JEM claimed that the forces, except one, were not part of the JEM.

On 5 December 2023, fishermen seized five boats from Ugandan fishermen along Nyang'wina beach in Muhuru Bay (Nyatike, Migori) over territorial trespass in Lake Victoria. The motive was allegedly due to a retaliation, following the move by Ugandan authorities to capture four Kenyan boats.
On 5 December 2023, a mob cornered and lynched two men on a motorcycle in Diani (Msambweni, Kwale) for allegedly snatching a porch from a female pedestrian.

Around 5 December 2023 (between 5 - 6 December), residents lynched a suspected dahalo in Ambalanirana Fiadanana near Ambositra (Ambositra, Amoron I Mania). They were bringing him to the gendarmerie, but he escaped and was beaten to death.

On 5 December 2023, residents clashed with police officers in front of the police station in Vavatenina (Vavatenina, Analanjirofo), following the murder of a man the day before. They were looking for the murderer and threw stones at the police station, resulting in a police officer injured. Police and military officers dispersed the crowd (means unspecified).

Non-violent activity: On 5 December 2023, RSF closed Kutum market (Kutum, North Darfur) after traders refused to pay taxes to the RSF. RSF claimed it closed the market to address 'negative phenomena' in the city such as the proliferation of arms and drugs (which the traders denied).

On 5 December 2023, around 200 striking workers from Hotel Llana gathered in front of the hotel in Santa Maria (Nossa Senhora das Dores, Sal) against the delayed payment of their salaries and the non-compliance with social security.

Joined by Kenya Union of Post Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) representatives, the group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 5 December 2023, pastoralist community members protested in Pangani area of Lamu county (coded to the county Head quarters as Lamu, Lamu West, Lamu) against increased cases of abduction and killing by security officers. Joined by Haki Africa representatives and a lawyer, the group demanded government to address the matter.

On 5 December 2023, over 700 Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Kwale County marched along the Mombasa-Lunga-Lunga highway at Ukunda (Msambweni, Kwale) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement.

On 5 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Makueni County gathered Wote town (Makueni, Makueni) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement.

Joined by the area member of county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the county authorities and the cabinet secretary for lands to help address the matter.

On 5 December 2023, Fargo workers gathered in Limbe (Blantyre City, Southern), demanding the payment of three-month salary arrears. They sealed the main gate of the company's headquarters. Police officers were present, no interaction.

The text of the bill would be presented at first reading to the national assembly on the same day.

On 5 December 2023, hundreds of Renamo member and supporters marched in Maputo (Maputo City, Maputo) demanding clarification on the possibility of prosecuting judges who are advisors to the Constitutional Council in the approval of the October election results. The election results have been defrauded and schedule for a repeat on 10 December in four cities.

notes: On 5 December 2023, Renamo supporters gathered in demonstration outside the Murrupelane primary school in Nacala Porto (Nacala, Nampula). The demonstrations follows electoral fraud allegations and the Constitutional Council decision to repeat voting in specific polling stations in the city while RENAMO claims that the repeat should be done in all polling stations. The group demanded local residents to leave the area because of potential coming violence on 10 December (day of the scheduled revoting) in the school/polling station considering previous police action.

They also called for the recusal of a lawyer accused of 'xenophobia' from the inquiry, alleging unfair treatment of foreign nationals who were wrongly accused of lacking documents, despite having lost them in the fire. The demonstrators included Kopanang Africa Against Xenophobia, the Inner City Federation, Keep Left, Inner City Resource Center, and the GIWUSA.

On 5 December 2023, a group of 150 international pro-Palestinian demonstrators laid wreaths at the feet of Nelson Mandela's statue at the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to commemorate the 10th anniversary of the death of Nelson Mandela and in support of a 'Free Palestine' in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. Friends of Palestine members and the Minister of Social Development joined the protest.

On 5 December 2023, a small crowd of civil society groups picketed outside of the Sci-Bono Discovery Centre in Johannesburg - Newtown (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) to demand justice for fire victims who have since been displaced due to the fire.

On 5 December 2023, community members, family, church (unspecified), and activists marched to the Soshanguve Police Station in Soshanguve (City of Tshwane, Gauteng), calling for justice for a 17-year-old boy who was murdered and sexually assaulted near the Echibini Secondary School.

On 5 December 2023, overnight, Al Shabaab threw a hand grenade against the residence of a government soldier (SNA) (assumed off duty) in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). There were no fatalities. The soldier and his wife were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (South Africa); Police Forces of South Africa (1994-)
notes: On 5 December 2023, residents demonstrated in Hlobane (Abaqulusi, Zululand, KwaZulu-Natal), demanding to meet with the town council speaker over electricity being cut due to illegal connections. The gathering turned violent as rioters pelted stones and rocks at municipal employees, vandalized municipal property, and stole a generator. Some employees were hospitalized after the incident. Police intervened by firing rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. One resident died in unknown circumstances amid the unrest (further details unknown/not reported).

source: Correo del Sur; El Diario (Bolivia); Opinion (Bolivia)
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Vinto (Cochabamba), residents blocked the Oruro - Cochabamba - La Paz highway as a demonstration to demand the extraction of 11 water wells for potable water and to transfer the lands with water sources to their district's jurisdiction, to be used for their sector.

On 5 December 2023, in Alerce (Los Lagos), residents of the La Colonia neighborhood set barricades on fire, parked vehicles across a road and banged pots to demonstrate over delays in the delivery of drinking water. The company previously responsible for these deliveries was being investigated for fraud. Demonstrators stated that the new company had failed to deliver water to some areas and that in others, it had only delivered half the expected volume. Police dispersed the demonstrators.

source: Biobio Chile; El Mercurio (Chile); La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Santiago (Metropolitana), over 100 members of housing committees from the Metropolitana and Valparaiso regions and the Ukamau settler movement protested outside the Ministry of Housing to express support for the current Minister. The Minister had come under criticism from the opposition following a highly mediatised corruption scandal involving a foundation in Antofagasta (Caso Convenios). The opposition had called for his resignation and was considering tabling a Constitutional Accusation, which, if approved, would lead to his removal. The Minister addressed the crowd with a megaphone.

On 5 December 2023, in Jiutepec, Morelos, several armed individuals traveling on two motorcycles and in a taxi intercepted a man in Colonia Atlacomulco and kidnapped him. The whereabouts of the man remain unknown.

On 5 December 2023, in San Lorenzo, Nuevo Leon, protesters closed the entrance to the city to demand the approval of the 40 hour working week and to demand the Chamber of Deputies to approve the constitutional reform.
On 5 December 2023, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed men intercepted the man and opened fire at him in Colonia Nino Artillero. The man died as a result. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, in Esquel (Futaleufu, Chubut), brigade members of the Provincial Fire Management Service (SPMF) demonstrated in front of the Secretariat of Forests and Parks to demand salary improvements. The protesters also denounced the lack of safety equipment to carry out their work.

On 5 December 2023, in Trevelin (Futaleufu, Chubut), artisans and fairground workers marched through the main streets of Pueblo del Molino to demand that the municipality withdraw the new regulation controlling the Alfarero Fernandez Garralda fair operations in Fontana Square.

On 5 December 2023, in Trelew (Rawson, Chubut), residents and police officers marched in front of the Courts and Public Prosecutor's Office in support of police officers judicially processed for harassment and severe injuries in a 2016 case.

On 5 December 2023, in Rondonopolis (Mato Grosso), two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and injured a man in a drive-by shooting in the Jardim Liberdade neighborhood. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 5 December 2023, a man biked up to the Fifth Avenue menorah and knocked it to the ground in New York - Manhattan (New York). This event took place in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas.
Other: Around 5 December 2023 (as reported), Patriot Front Network 3 affiliates dropped a banner in Casper (Wyoming) that read 'America First' and promoting Patriot Front.

On 5 December 2023, protesters and members of the Israeli community held a pro-Israel rally in West Hartford (Connecticut) to support the people of Israel and to call for the release of Hamas hostages in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas.

On 5 December 2023, about 30 protesters, faculty, and members of the United Council of Academics rallied at Fenster Hall on campus of the New Jersey Institute of Technology in Newark (New Jersey) to demand higher salaries and bargaining in good faith, as well as to announce a strike.

notes: On 5 December 2023, protesters and members of the NY SANE coalition, Make the Road NY, Housing Justice For All, Women In Need, VOCAL - NY and Legal Aid Society rallied in Bowling Green Park in New York - Manhattan (New York) to support the preservation of the Right to Shelter law, and to call for more resources to provide shelter for the homeless and papers for the children of homeless and migrants. New York City Public Advocate Jumaane Williams (D) joined the rally.
On 5 December 2023, more than 100 telecommunications workers, including Unifor members, staged a rally in Kingston (Ontario) to protest against Bell's management for not providing job security.

assoc_actor_1: VOCAL-NY: Voices Of Community Activists and Leaders - New York
notes: On 5 December 2023, protesters and members of VOCAL - NY rallied in Albany (New York) to support the preservation of the Right to Shelter law, and to call for more resources to provide shelter for the homeless and papers for the children of homeless and migrants.

On 5 December 2023, members of BikeHouston gathered on Houston Avenue in Houston (Texas) to protest for increased bike lanes and improved safety for cyclists. This protest was organized after a cyclist was hit by a car and later died from the injuries. District H Councilwoman Karla Cisneros was present.

On 5 December 2023, a group of pro-Palestine protesters gathered on the University of Texas Rio Grande campus in Edinburg (Texas) to demonstrate their support for Palestinian civilians and to condemn the Israeli government in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. The protest was organized by students and included protesters of Palestinian descent. A group of pro-Israel counter-protesters who were also students at the university gathered during the protest to demonstrate their support for Israel's 'right to self-defense.'

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (United States); PSL: Party for Socialism and Liberation
notes: On 5 December 2023, hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters and teachers rallied outside President Biden's fundraising event at the Shubert Theatre in Boston (Massachusetts) to support Palestine and to condemn the president's policy of sending aid to Israel, which they claim led to 'genocide' in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. Demonstrators also 'charged Biden with genocide'. The Party for Socialism and Liberation organized the rally.

On 5 December 2023, a group of protesters gathered outside the Collin County courthouse in McKinney (Texas) to protest for the resignation of State Representative Frederick Frazier (R) following him accepting plea deals on charges related to his election in 2022. He accepted plea deals for criminal mischief and attempted impersonation of a public servant, which protesters claimed harmed his opponent's campaign.

On 5 December 2023, about 60 pro-Palestinian demonstrators rallied at the city council in Long Beach (California) to demand the council pass a resolution calling for a ceasefire in Gaza and to condemn what they called Israeli 'occupation' in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. After several disruptions to the meeting by demonstrators, private security officers cleared the room and the meeting continued without any members of the public.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (United States); Labor Group (United States); SEIU: Service Employees International Union
notes: On 5 December 2023, health workers with SEIU staged an informational picket outside the Orchards nursing home and rehabilitation center in Detroit (Michigan) to demand higher wages.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (United States); SEIU: Service Employees International Union; Labor Group (United States)
notes: On 5 December 2023, West Broward Rehabilitation and Healthcare workers joined members from the United Healthcare Workers East union (part of SEIU) in Plantation (Florida) to demand better working conditions.

assoc_actor_1: Jewish Group (United States); Palestinian Group (United States); JVP: Jewish Voice for Peace
notes: On 5 December 2023, about 200 pro-Palestinian Jewish and Palestinian American supporters demonstrated inside the city council in Berkeley (California) to demand a 'Free Palestine' and that the council pass a resolution calling for a ceasefire in Gaza and calling for the US to end its support for Israel's military in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. The demonstration included JVP.

assoc_actor_1: Latin American Group (United States); Labor Group (United States)
notes: On 5 December 2023, several dozen small business owners and supporters rallied in the middle of Valencia Street in San Francisco (California) to demand the city remove a bike lane that they state negatively affects their businesses. The rally was organized by the San Francisco Small Business Coalition and joined by the San Francisco Latinx Democratic Club.

On 5 December 2023, around 300 students and supporters rallied outside Fisher Science at California Polytechnic in San Luis Obispo (California) to demand support for LGBTQ+ rights during an anti-transgender Turning Point USA event inside. The rally included the school's Drag Club.

actor2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 5 December 2023, a group of people gathered in Decatur (Alabama) to demand answers after a Black man was shot and killed by the police on September 29. According to the Alabama Law Enforcement Agency (ALEA), the man was shot after he pointed a weapon toward an officer. One protester was arrested and charged with disorderly conduct. The event was organized in support of the Black Lives Matter movement.

assoc_actor_1: SEIU: Service Employees International Union; AAUP: American Association of University Professors; Labor Group (United States); Teachers (United States); IBT: International Brotherhood of Teamsters; DEM: Democratic Party; Government of the United States (2021-); African American Group (United States); Students (United States); BSU: Black Student Union

The picket was part of a strike at four universities this week organized by the California Faculty Association (affiliated with SEIU and AAUP). They were joined by the Black Student Union, Teamsters Local 2010, and city district Supervisor Connie Chan (D).

assoc_actor_1: SEIU: Service Employees International Union; Labor Group (United States)

They were organized by SEIU Local 521.

assoc_actor_1: Students (United States); Jewish Group (United States); Teachers (United States)
notes: On 5 December 2023, over 150 demonstrators rallied on the campus of Ohio State University in Columbus (Ohio) to protest recent antisemitic incidents both locally and nationally. Those present included students, faculty, and Jewish leaders.

assoc_actor_1: Students (United States); Teachers (United States); Palestinian Group (United States); SJP: Students for Justice in Palestine
notes: On 5 December 2023, around 50-70 pro-Palestinian demonstrators rallied and staged a die-in outside the Starbucks at the University of Hawaii Campus Center in Honolulu (Hawaii) to mourn Palestinian casualties and demand a boycott of Starbucks and other companies that work with Israel as they claimed it commits 'ethnic cleansing' and 'genocide' in the wake of renewed fighting between Israel and Hamas. The rally was organized by the University of Hawaii Students and Faculty for Justice in Palestine (SFJPUH), Sea to Sea 808, and Rise for Palestine, and included Palestinian supporters.
On 5 December 2023, about 15 people demonstrated outside El Monte City Hall in El Monte (California) to demand support for Mayor Jessica Ancona amid a lawsuit against the mayor.

On 5 December 2023, more than two dozen people protested outside the County Administration Building in Stuart (Florida) in opposition to land development before a meeting where a change in the land-use designation was being voted on. The protesters were against large-scale developments being allowed, such as homes and golf courses.
On 5 December 2023, protesters gathered outside the Schuylkill County Courthouse in Pottsville (Pennsylvania) to demand justice for two New Philadelphia teenagers who were murdered on 10 October.

On 5 December 2023, demonstrators rallied at a city council meeting in Columbus (Indiana) to protest the planned use of a property as a 'mixed-use apartment project.' Those present included members of Hoosier Action.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
source: CBS19 (Cleveland); Washington Post - Police Shooting Data; WKYC Studios
notes: On 5 December 2023, a police officer shot and killed an unarmed 24-year-old man in Canton (Ohio) when they were called to a private residence to investigate calls of an armed man involved in an argument. According to body camera footage, an officer approached the victim who was walking across the road and called for him 'to get on the ground and place his hands on his head' as the man was walking away from the officer. As the man was turning around, the police officer shot him. The police officer at the time claimed he was reaching for a weapon. In body camera footage, the victim has his hands in his pockets with his back turned to the officer. During the investigation, it was revealed that the victim had a pellet gun. The victim was transported to a hospital where he died of his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 5 December 2023, around 50 Sciences Po students blocked access to the school's main building in Paris (Ile-de-France) to call for the resignation of director Mathias Vicherat, accused by his wife of domestic violence, and accusing her of domestic violence too. Some participants condemned gender-based violence.

On 5 December 2023, Sciences Po students gathered outside their campus in Reims (Grand Est) to call for the resignation of director Mathias Vicherat, accused by his wife of domestic violence, and accusing her of domestic violence too. Some participants condemned gender-based violence.

On 5 December 2023, students, professors, and women gathered at the Faculties of Medicine and Psychology of the University 'La Sapienza' in Rome - Tiburtino (Lazio) to commemorate a 22-year-old recently killed by her former boyfriend and protest against femicide and violence against women.

On 5 December 2023, people, including members of the humanitarian and development organization 'Action Against Hunger', with the support of WeAct (Campact's petition platform), protested in Berlin (Berlin) and handed over a petition signed by 77,000 people as part of the campaign 'Nestle: Stop your advertising for baby milk' to call on Nestle to adhere to the guidelines of the WHO and stop advertising for powdered baby milk.

On 5 December 2023, around 100 environmental activists gathered outside the Court of Justice in Digne-les-Bains (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to express solidarity with two women who were on trial for the blockade of construction work on the Cruis photovoltaic facility in October 2023.

On 5 December 2023, around 30 workers of the Bellamar residence in Castell-Platja d'Aro as well as CCOO members held a protest in Castell de Aro (Girona, Cataluna) to demand better working conditions and denounce work overload.

On 5 December 2023, around 150 university students and representatives of self-managed social centers, including Askatasuna, gathered outside the Einaudi Campus in Torino (Piemonte) to oppose a leafleting carried out by students and members of the right-wing students' organization FUAN. Clashes occurred between demonstrators and the police, who protected FUAN members. After the clashes, students and activists took to the city's streets to demonstrate against fascism. Clashes resulted in 11 injuries among the officers, two law professors who tried to mediate, and demonstrators. 30 participants will be charged with private violence and violence against public officials.

On 5 December 2023, between 20 and 30 unidentified residents of the Ameland island attacked a camera crew in the island of Ameland (coded to Hollum, Friesland) that had arrived to film the secret Sunneklaas tradition taking place every 5 December. They attacked the car, which suffered significant damage, and then chased it. The Coast Guard and police officers were involved in the journalists' evacuation from the island.

On 5 December 2023, villagers from Cenggu and Renda clashed in Cenggu village (Belo district, Bima regency, West Nusa Tenggara province). It was triggered by an arrow shot targeting a Renda villager when passing Cenggu village a day before. The motive for the shooting was unknown. The villagers carried arrows, machetes, and spears. A house in Cenggu village was burned and a shop was looted. A Renda villager sustained an open wound and had to be hospitalized. The police fired warning shots to disperse the clash.

On 5 December 2023, a group of workers protested at the Medika Stania private hospital in Sungailiat district (Bangka regency, Bangka-Belitung province). It was related to a rumor regarding a massive job transfer to Karimun Island, Riau Islands province.

Farmers temporarily blocked the Stefan cel Mare boulevard with their vehicles and produce brought to the protests.
On 5 December 2023, employees of the National Statistics Institute branch protested in Alba Iulia, complaining that the recent wage increases did not apply to them too.

On 5 December 2023, tens of Orthodox Christian priests and believers protested outside the Embassy of Ukraine in Chisinau - Buiucani, demanding a fair trial for a monk at the Banceni monastery in the Chernivetska oblast of Ukraine.
On 5 December 2023, around 50 people marched in Aalborg to show support and solidarity with the people of Palestine.

Activists from the Association of Child and Youth Educators (BUPL), National Union of Students in Denmark (DSF), and various trade unions took part in the event, among others.

On 5 December 2023, the Nordic Resistance Movement activists demonstrated in Jonkoping to promote the movement's national socialist values and to oppose multiculturalism. Police personnel were present to ensure security of the event.

On 5 December 2023, about 500 small retail shop owners of the Dordoy Motors auto parts market protested at the Maxim Gorky square near Oktyabr district in Bishkek city against mandatory usage of cash register machines by retailers calling for the country's government to allow small businesses operate under patent license without using cash register devices. Similarly, about 200 protesters demonstrated at the Osh bazaar market in the city against the new tax regime.

On 5 December 2023, small retail business owners protested at the main square in the town of Naryn against mandatory usage of cash register machines by retailers demanding that the country's government allow small shops to operate without using cash register devices.

On 5 December 2023, farmers of the Zhambyl region gathered outside the regional state administration in Taraz city in protest of failure by the local authorities to provide emergency aid to farmers after loss of crops due to drought months earlier in the summer demanding that the administration resolve their grievances regarding delivery of aid.
On 5 December 2023, IDPs in Kutaisi City organized a protest against an alleged demolition of a building they live in.

On 5 December 2023, an employee of the Mine Action Agency of the Republic of Azerbaijan was hit by a landmine, likely planted by Artsakh forces, in Sarijali, Askeran region, as a result of which part of his leg was amputated.

On 5 December 2023, residents of Alaverdi and members of the A Country to Live In party protested and blocked the entrance to the community hall in Alaverdi, Lori region, demanding new elections after the community council expressed no confidence in the major of Alaverdi who was a member of A Country to Live In party and instead appointed a new major from the Civil Contract party. The police intervened in the protest and detained several members of the A Country to Live In party.

On 5 December 2023, feminist activists and their supporters protested in Pristina after the murder of a young woman by her partner, and demanding concrete efforts from the police in preventing this as well as support for women facing spousal abuse.

On 5 December 2023, feminist activists and their supporters protested in Kacanik after the murder of a young woman by her partner, and demanding concrete efforts from the police in preventing this as well as support for women facing spousal abuse.

On 5 December 2023, protesters in solidarity with the Roma communities marched in Thessaloniki, following a call by collectives of the anti-establishment sector, demanding justice for the fatal shootings of Roma teenagers Frangoulis, Sambanis and Michalopoulos by police. The march was observed by strong police forces.
On 5 December 2023, lawyers, who had been striking for days, marched in central Thessaloniki carrying a banner to protest against the government's proposed tax reforms.

On 5 December 2023, thousands of self-employed and freelance professionals, including lawyers and taxi drivers, rallied at Syntagma square in Athens - Central Athens carrying banners and flags to protest against the government's proposed tax reforms and demanded the withdrawal of the bill soon to be voted on in parliament.

On 5 December 2023, students protested against police violence by forming with their school bags the names of Alexandros Grigoropoulos and Vassilis Mangos, who were killed by police, in their schoolyard in Volos. The protesters were holding each other forming a circle.

On 5 December 2023, primary school children in Parekklisia, organized by their parents' association, participated in a 2-hour protest-strike over inadequate facilities at their school. They lined up outside the school holding banners, demanding more funding and better-quality conditions.

On 5 December 2023, self-employed and freelance professionals from tens of professional sectors rallied outside the Ministry of Macedonia and Thrace in Thessaloniki to protest against the government's proposed tax reforms and demanded the withdrawal of the bill soon to be voted on in parliament.

It was unclear if the drone had been shot down or had returned back.

On 5 December 2023, members of the BJP staged a protest at the police station in Aligarh city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding action against the constables whom the protesters accused of behaving indecently with the son of the BJP Metropolitan Vice President.

On 5 December 2023, relatives of a Dalit woman held a protest outside the Manasa police station in Jabalpur city (Madhya Pradesh) against the suspected case of 'torture' against the woman (coded separately).

On 5 December 2023, farmers affiliated to the Lower Bhavani Farmers' Federation staged a protest at the Collectorate in Erode city (Tamil Nadu) demanding the district administration to release water in the canal for the second crop season according to the order of Cauvery Water Disputes Tribunal. Protesters also submitted a petition to the Collector.

On 5 December 2023, members of the Mahadayi Kalasa-Banduri Horata Samanvaya Samiti (Mahadayi Kalasa-Banduri Struggle Coordination Committee, a farmers' group) staged a protest march in Hubballi city (Dharwad, Karnataka) demanding the INC-led state government to implement the Kalasa Banduri project which seeks to divert water from the six water bodies to the Malaprabha River to meet the drinking water needs of Belagavi, Dharwad, Gadag and Bagalkot districts.

On 5 December 2023, members of the Mahadayi Kalasa-Banduri Horata Samanvaya Samiti (Mahadayi Kalasa-Banduri Struggle Coordination Committee, a farmers' group) staged a protest march in Belagavi city (Karnataka) demanding the INC-led state government to implement the Kalasa Banduri project which seeks to divert water from the six water bodies to the Malaprabha River to meet the drinking water needs of Belagavi, Dharwad, Gadag and Bagalkot districts.

On 5 December 2023, farmers staged a sit-in protest at the Water Resources department office premises in Melur town (Madurai, Tamil Nadu) against the DMK-led state government's decision to not release water from the Vagai dam for irrigation.

On 5 December 2023, fishermen under the aegis of the Kerala Paramparagatha Matsya Thozhilali Samithi (a forum of traditional fishermen) staged a protest and formed a human chain on the Goshree bridge in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) demanding the CPI(M)-led state government to take measures to improve the facilities at the Kalamukku fish landing centre. Protesters also stopped the car of an MLA and demanded the elected representative to take action.
On 5 December 2023, locals led by a former councilor held a protest at Rajouri town (J&K) over lack water supply in their area.

notes: On 5 December 2023, non-gazetted police pensioners held a protest at Jammu city (J&K) to demand benefits as per the fifth pay commission retrospectively from the year 1996 as had been done in other services and increase in pension.

assoc_actor_1: Government of India (2014-); INC: Indian National Congress
notes: On 5 December 2023, members of the municipal council including the municipal chairperson belonging to the INC and the chairpersons of various standing committees staged a protest and attempted to lay siege to the office of the Kerala Water Authority Chief Engineer in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) against the water scarcity issue in Maradu municipality. Protesters condemned the delay in resolving the issue.

On 5 December 2023, members of the Hattee Yuva Vichar Manch staged a protest in Nahan town (Sirmaur, Himachal Pradesh) against the delay in the implementation of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) status to the Hattee community of the trans-Giri area of Sirmaur.

On 5 December 2023, residents of Mohmand district, including HDT members, staged a protest against power cuts near Ghalanai grid station in Ghalani city (Mohmand, KPK) due to excessive electricity load shedding.

On 5 December 2023, health workers and members of various unions under the Health department, including the Master Cadre Union, staged a massive dharna (sit-in protest), raising slogans, in front of the Civil surgeon's office in Amritsar city (Punjab) in support of the ongoing protests by the Punjab State Ministerial Service Union demanding the implementation of the old pension scheme, regularization of contractual jobs, and release of dearness allowance.

On 5 December 2023, 9 people abducted and assaulted a mining inspector near Chak Saido Ke village (Fazilka, Punjab) after the mining inspector attempted to intervene in a suspected illegal mining activity. 3 people were later arrested.

On 5 December 2023, Anganwadi workers (community health workers, mostly women) under the aegis of Maharashtra State Anganwadi Balwadi Workers Union and Kolhapur District Anganwadi Workers Union started indefinite sit-in protests outside the district collector office in Kolhapur city (Maharashtra) over their several long pending demands including regular salary and increment in every six months.

On 5 December 2023, 5-7 people assaulted a man with sticks, after tying him to a pole, near Paramount Colony in Saharanpur city (Uttar Pradesh) over suspicions of stealing iron rods. A video of the incident was circulated online. One person was arrested.

On 5 December 2023, two groups of police personnel clashed at the Kaithu area's Police lines in Shimla city (Himachal Pradesh) for unidentified reasons. A few police personnel were injured including one serious injury.

On 5 December 2023, workers at a private company held a protest at Barnoti town (Kathua district, J&K) against Mega Engineering and Infrastructure Limited over being denied an increase in pay, time for lunch and lack of winter wear for workers.

On 5 December 2023, members of the Retired Employees Welfare Association along with trade unions staged a protest and conducted a flyer campaign in Krishnagiri city (Tamil Nadu) with a list of complaints including the government not compensating the losses incurred by the transport corporation, the cutting down of the basic pension amount and the number of pending appointments on compassionate grounds. Protesters also highlighted that the deductions made from the staff salaries towards welfare were not remitted into their accounts.

On 5 December 2023, members of the Retired Employees Welfare Association along with trade unions staged protests and distributed flyers at all bus depots across Tamil Nadu state (coded to Chennai) with a list of complaints including the government not compensating the losses incurred by the transport corporation, the cutting down of the basic pension amount and the number of pending appointments on compassionate grounds. Protesters also highlighted that the deductions made from the staff salaries towards welfare were not remitted into their accounts.

On 5 December 2023, local people staged a protest along the Bareilly-Budaun road in Bhamora village (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of an elderly man who was hit and killed by a bus while cycling.

On 5 December 2023, members of the INC staged a protest in front of the Ellaa Hotel in the Gachibowli area in Hyderabad city (Telangana) demanding that their leader be announced as the next Chief Minister of Telangana after the INC won the state assembly elections. A couple of protesters attempted to set themselves on fire and were detained by the police.

On 5 December 2023, residents under the aegis of Zilla Sangharsh Samiti (district action committee) picketed and held protests, during a 12-hour bandh (shutdown strike), in Kantabanji town (Balangir, Odisha) demanding district status for the region. The protestors also submitted a memorandum to the Chief Minister regarding their demand.

On 5 December 2023, locals from Sarigam village held a protest outside the regional office of Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) in Vapi city (Valsad district, Gujarat) against groundwater pollution in their area.

On 5 December 2023, locals staged a protest at the Dabbalikatte plantation of the Forest Department in Yeslur village (Hassan, Karnataka) demanding the officials to conduct the last rites of an elephant who had died in a fight with a wild elephant at a more appropriate location. Protesters also demanded the suspension of the officers who, according to them, were responsible for the death of the elephant.

On 5 December 2023, around 100 residents of Shanthi Nagar in Vyasarpadi and residents of Old Washermenpet staged a protest in their localities Chennai city (Tamil Nadu) against officials for not draining out the floodwater and providing relief materials in the aftermath of cyclone Michaung. Protesters also said their elected representatives had not visited them.

On 5 December 2023, militants (coded as TTP) detonated a remote explosive outside Peshawar public school injuring 7, including 4 children on Warsak Road in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). The explosive weighed 4 kg.
On 5 December 2023, after a fire exchange between security forces and militants (coded as TTP), one soldier was killed in Sararogha district (South Waziristan, KPK).

On 5 December 2023, a tribal elder died in the detention under severe torture by the Taliban forces in Tirzayee (Alisher) district, Khost. While the circumstances leading to his arrest remained unknown, some believe that he was targeted due to his close affiliation with the previous government.

On 5 December 2023, an explosion took place targeting a Taliban checkpoint in Gulai Dawakhana on the west area of Kabul city. While it remained unknown whether the Taliban members had any casualties, an eyewitness confirmed the wounding of at least two civilians in the incident. No group has claimed responsibility.
On 5 December 2023, unknown armed men shot dead a Taliban police commander in Badam Darrah area of Taluqan city, Takhar and seized his weapon. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 5 December 2023, at least 15-20 members of ARSA shot and killed 2 members of rival RSO organization, and injured 1 other, at Ukhiya refugee camp, Ukhia upazila (Cox's Bazar, Chittagong), over establishing supremacy.

He stepped on the mine in ward 1 while going to collect lime at a lime farm.
