Displacement: Around 5 December 2023, near Monglon town (Kyaukme township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), over 500 locals were forced to flee their homes due to the battle between the military and the TNLA (coded separately).

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Narinjara News; Shan Herald Agency for News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; VOA
notes: On 5 December 2023, in Monglon town (Kyaukme township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), the Ta'ang National Liberation Army attacked the Myanmar military IB-71 outpost around 5:30 am and seized it at 8 pm. During the armed clash, the military conducted airstrikes at least eight times around 9 am and the military based in Mogoke town returned fire with heavy weapons. A 45-year-old woman was killed and 10 locals including three children and a disabled person from A Htet Aung Myay ward were injured due to the military airstrike. Five houses were also destroyed. The TNLA troops seized 13 weapons including 60 mm and 80 mm heavy weapons and accessories.

Displacement: On 5 December 2023, in Maungdaw township (Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), about 300 villagers from villages located near the Baw Di Kone base, including Shwe Yin Aye, Baw Di Kone and Kan Thar Yar villages, were forced to flee after the No.5 Border Guard Police threatened villagers that they would fire artillery rounds into their villages.

actor1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
source: Kachin News Group; Mizzima; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency
notes: On 5 December 2023, between Nam Mun town and Bi Lu villages (coded as Nam Mun) (Mohnyin township, Mohnyin district, Kachin state), a combined force of the KIA (brigade 8 - battalion 35) and the PDF (under the NUG) attacked and captured an air defense camp of the Myanmar military located near the Bi Lu hydropower plant at around 3 pm. The camp was stationed by about 30 military troops. Casualties unknown.

On 5 December 2023, in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a combined force of the Depeyin Local Mobile Team and another local defense force attacked a hilltop sentry, providing security to the Northwestern Military Command Headquarters in the morning and both sides exchanged fire. The military soldiers abandoned the sentry and the combined force seized a weapon, ammunition and military equipment from the sentry. There were 3 fatalities and 3 injuries on the military side.

On 5 December 2023, near Kyauk Sit Pon village (coded as Kyauk Sit Pon (North)) (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a combined force of the Black Vote Fighter and a dozen of local defense forces attacked a military artillery battalion with 60 mm, 80 mm and 120 mm artillery rounds. The military also fired back with 60 mm artillery rounds. There were at least 10 fatalities and 5 injuries on the military side.
On 5 December 2023, in Muse township (Muse district, Shan-North state), fighting broke out between the Myanmar military and unidentified armed groups in the 105 Maing trade zone. Casualties unknown.

notes: On 4 December 2023, M23 killed two senior Burundian Army Officers during a clash with the FARDC/Wazalendo in Masisi (Osso, Masisi, Nord-Kivu). 2 fatalities reported. The victims lost their lives while fighting for the FARDC, wearing the FARDC army uniform. Several other Burundian soldiers have been killed and wounded, and there are reports of additional soldiers being captured by the M23.

On 4 December 2023, the MNJTF troops of 242 Battalion cleared ISWAP enclaves in Ngurnoa, Gumnari, Nairawa and engaged the militia in a firefight in Amburam village, coded to Gunmari (Monguno, Borno). They killed five ISWAP fighters, and one Nigerian soldier got injured in the clash. They recovered 1 x GPMG and 4 x AK 47 magazines.

On 4 December 2023, a thousand young people gathered in Bardai (Tibesti, Tibesti Est) to denounce the referendum on the constitution organized by the government, against a unitarian state and calling for a federal state in Chad.

On 4 December 2023, the Nigerian police engaged ISWAP in a firefight at a police checkpoint in Mairari, coded to Konduga (Konduga, Borno). The militia invaded the checkpoint, but the police repelled them. They damaged the Police Armored Personnel Carrier and went away with two police rifles. There were no fatalities.

Protesters held photos of the victim and a banner.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)

notes: Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Potrerito (Valle del Cauca), a father and his teenage son were killed, and their bodies were found with signs of torture. The victims had been kidnapped by suspected members of the FARC's Jaime Martinez dissident group on 30 November in the Villa Colombia corregimiento. 2 fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Barrio Chino (Ica), agrarian workers blocked the South Pan American highway with rocks, logs and different objects as a demonstration to voice their grievances about poor communication by the Economy and Finances Ministry when it modified the 31110 Agrarian Law. They also demanded better working conditions and higher salaries. Police forces intervened and clashed with the workers to disperse them.

On 4 December 2023, in Chimore (Cochabamba), for the fourth consecutive day, transportation workers blocked the new highway to Cochabamba on N bridge as a demonstration to demand maintenance of the highway and a construction of an additional double lane.

On 4 December 2023, in Barra do Pirai (Rio de Janeiro), two men on a motorcycle shot a man in the head in a drive-by shooting in the Ceramica Uniao neighborhood. Motivation and perpetrators unknown. 1 fatality.
On 4 December 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Parque Paulista neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Nova Iguacu (Rio de Janeiro), two armed men shot two other men inside a bar. One of them died from his injuries, while the other was hit in the leg and injured. Witnesses claim the attack was caused by a territorial dispute between drug trafficking groups. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
source: Crimes News RJ; G1; O Globo; OTT-RJ; R7
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), the military police exchanged fire with CV members in the Morro da Covanca community Jacarepagua region. Four suspects were shot and killed. Moreover, a civilian app driver was also mistaken for a drug trafficker and killed by the police. 5 fatalities.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Sao Paulo - East Zone (Sao Paulo), a man was killed and his body was found tied to his bed (likely execution), with signs of violence, in the Jardim Samara neighborhood. Motivation and perpetrators unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Santiago - Quilicura (Metropolitana), residents of the San Saturnino Housing Complex set barricades on fire to demonstrate over the poor condition of their housing. Demonstrators expressed frustration with humidity, leaks and poor fittings, as well as with the pace of new work to repair pumps in three buildings, and demanded that the Ministry of Housing allocate funds to repairs.

On 4 December 2023, in Astrea (Cesar), armed individuals on a motorcycle shot at a cattle farmer outside his home in a drive-by shooting in the Santander neighborhood. The victim was injured and taken to hospital in Bosconia where he died from his injuries on 6 December. There is no further information on the motives or perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.
On 4 December 2023, in the rural area of Bahia Solano (Choco), members of the military forces clashed with Gulf Clan militants in the Playa Potes vereda. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), a group of people beat two men accused of stealing a motorcycle in the La Campana sector. The individuals were arrested by the police. There were no fatalities.
On 4 December 2023, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), a group of citizens beat up a suspected thief at the intersection of 64C and 86 streets in the Riomar sector. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Bucaramanga (Santander), a group of students staged demonstrations and blocked the entry to multiple buildings at the Santander Industrial University (UIS). The students protested against a project that would increase the tuition value for undergraduate programs at the institution.

On 4 December 2023, in Manaure (La Guajira), a group of salt cargo transporters protested at the facilities of the Sama company's salt scale. The demonstrators protested against the excessive theft of salt from the salt flats in the area, claiming that this affects their economic activity, and asked the local authorities for solutions.

On 4 December 2023, in Pescador corregimiento (Cauca), a group of Nasa Indigenous people blocked the National Route 25 (Pan-American Highway) to protest against the acts of violence, threats and killings of social leaders committed by armed groups in the region. The communities also protested over the possible creation of a new Indigenous reserve for Misak communities in the area. The demonstrators called for security guarantees for their communities.

On 4 December 2023, in Pinchote (Santander), a group of residents from the Congual and Capellania veredas protested against the poor condition of a road that connects the national route with their territories. The residents demand the repair of the road by the contractor Concay S.A., which uses heavy machinery for the 'Variante San Gil' project. They also asked the company to allow them to use an alternate route that was opened for the road project.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Piojo (Atlantico), a group of families from the Cementerio neighborhood, blocked the municipality's main road to demand solutions from the National Unit for Disaster Risk Management (UNGRD) for more than 50 families affected by natural disaster events in 2022, who were left without housing. The demonstrators claim that they have not received the rent subsidy for five months and have not been relocated.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Colombia); Labor Group (Colombia); Wayuu Indigenous Group (Colombia)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Riohacha (La Guajira), a group of Wayuu teachers and administrative workers from different rural institutions protested at the municipal Mayor's Office to demand the payment of salaries they are owed. They claimed that more than 200 education workers have not received their salaries for several months.

On 4 December 2023, in the rural area of Gamarra (Cesar), four armed men on motorcycles opened fire at the vehicle in which a Gamarra mayoral candidate for the People in Movement Party was traveling in Los Cedros vereda. The driver of the vehicle evaded the attack, and no one was injured. The victim is the brother of another former mayoral candidate whose candidacy was disqualified days before the local election on October 29, leading to riots that resulted in the burning of the municipal Registrar's Office. The candidate claimed that he has received phone threats before. The local election in Gamarra will take place on 24 December 2023. There were no fatalities.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Giraldo municipality (Antioquia), a man was shot and killed and his body was found in El Filo vereda. Authorities are investigating if the attack is related to retaliations from the Gulf Clan or other motives. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Colombia); Guardia Campesina (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in La Carmelita (Putumayo), unidentified individuals stabbed and killed a farmer social leader. He was also a member of the Guardia Campesina, the Putumayo's Environmental and Agrarian Coca Growers' Movement (MOVICCAAP), and the South East Putumayo Farmers Association (ACSOMAYO). There is no information on the motives or perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of the Carolina Ramirez FARC dissident group and the Frontier Command in the area. 1 fatality.

actor2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
notes: Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in La Pampa (Narino), military forces clashed with suspected members of the FARC's Second Marquetalia dissident faction and seized war materials, including rifles, communication equipment, and around 5,000 units of ammunition of various calibres. The soldiers arrested three members of the armed group and injured one, who later died due to his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Ocana (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and injured a man who was driving a vehicle on the Francisco Fernandez road. As a result of the gunfire, the victim ran over two motorcyclists who were on the road. Four people in total were injured as a result of the attack. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in San Miguel (Choco), members of the military forces clashed with Gulf Clan militants. A suspected member of the armed group was killed, and an unspecified number of militants were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in the rural area of San Vicente Ferrer municipality (Antioquia), a woman was shot and killed at her home in the Santa Rita vereda over a land dispute. There is no information on the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Sotomayor municipality (Narino), a social leader and president of the Council of Communal Action of the Cordilleras Andinas vereda was killed and his body was found. There is no further information about the reasons or the perpetrators of the attack, however, the area is known for the presence of the FARC dissident faction Franco Benavides, the ELN, and other criminal gangs. 1 fatality.

Around 4 December 2023, between Tame and Fortul (coded to Tame, Arauca), a person was shot and killed and their body was found in the Rio Culebrero sector. There is no further information about the motives or the perpetrators of the attack but there is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: UNE: National Union of Educators; Teachers (Ecuador)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), unionized teachers members of the National Union of Educators (UNE) staged a demonstration at San Francisco square to voice their grievances about the lack of actions of the government to protect teachers and students against criminal activity.

On 4 December 2023, in Rocafuerte (Manabi), around 200 farmers of Bolivar, Junin, Tosagua, Rocafuerte and Jaramijo district staged a demonstration outside the Multicompetent Judicial Unit offices to demand access to the aqueduct of the Pacific Refinery that was never constructed, for them to use for irrigation and consumption.

On 4 December 2023, in Chiclayo (Lambayeque), supporters of former president Pedro Castillo (Free Peru) staged a demonstration outside the Judicial Power offices to demand the resignation of president Dina Boluarte, the closure of congress and early presidential elections to be called.

On 4 December 2023, in Huancayo (Junin), parents of students at Nuestra Senora del Valle school staged a demonstration against the treasurer of the school that took the money that was going to be usted for the Christmas celebration and to pay salaries.

On 4 December 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), members of citizens' organizations and local residents staged a demonstration outside the Constitutional Tribunal and Public Ministry offices to demand the resignation of president Dina Boluarte, the closure of congress and early presidential elections to be called.

On 4 December 2023, in Guacima, Alajuela, people blocked roads in the Guacima Abajo sector to denounce the fact that several neighbors have not have water service for several days while the water institution has granted permits for changing water pipes for a real estate company's big project. The protesters expressed that they would not lift the blockades until the institution gives them an answer to the recurring water problems.

On 4 December 2023, in Las Vueltas, Alajuela, people blocked roads to denounce the fact that several neighbors have not have water service for several days while the water institution has granted permits for changing water pipes for a real estate company's big project. The protesters expressed that they would not lift the blockades until the institution gives them an answer to the recurring water problems.

On 4 December 2023, in San Jose, San Jose, people with disabilities from different groups protested in commemoration of the International Day of Persons with Disabilities. The protesters marched to the Legislative Assembly. They read a manifesto demanding the respect of their rights and the participation of people from the community in any law initiative that concerns them. They also handed a law project that aims to change a former reform that was made to the Family Code.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Parramos, Chimaltenango, a man was killed and his dismembered body was left in plastic bags, in the street. The body was in advanced state of decomposition and authorities believe he was killed six days before the finding. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: 48 Cantones of Totonicapan; Maya Indigenous Group (Guatemala)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, people, including indigenous leaders, protested in zone 1. People demonstrated against the approval of the 2024 budget and the withdrawn of immunities for four judges of the Electoral Supreme Court. In addition, they demanded the resignation of the Solicitor General. This is part of a wave of nation-wide demonstrations called by the 48 Cantones de Totonicapan (Maya indigenous group) (coded separately).

On 4 December 2023, near Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Solola, there was an armed clash between members of the Nahuala and Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan communal militias. As a result of the clashes, three police officers who were patrolling the area were shot and injured. During the evacuation of the injured, more shots were fired against the military and police trucks. There is a territorial dispute between the two communities over the control of a farm located between the two municipalities. 3 injured.

On 4 December 2023, in Gonaives, Artibonite, several tens of merchants, led by the Artibonite Drivers and Transporters Union, held a demonstration to demand the departure of the head of the municipal commission after the destruction of a local market, the so called 'Topa Market', by order of the local authorities the weekend prior. Demonstrators, who held tree branches, set up barricades of burning tires on several roads.

On 4 December 2023, in Caracol, Nord-Est, citizens and associations of transporters and entrepreneurs of Trou-du-Nord held a protest and blocked the National Road 6, at the height of the Champin neighbourhood, demanding the reopening of the Haitian-Dominican border.
On 4 December 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, unidentified gunmen aboard a car shot and killed a vendor in the Medina neighborhood (drive-by). The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, members of various LGBTQ+ organizations protested in front of the first station of the National Police to demand that the authorities accelerate the investigative proceedings in the case of a trans woman who was kidnapped from her business on November 24. The woman was kidnapped by four armed men wearing uniforms from the Anti Maras and Gangs Police Directorate Against Organized Crime (DIPMAMPCO) (coded separately). The DIPAMPCO later dismissed the accusations stating that no arrests had been made in that sector. Since then, the victim's whereabouts had been unknown.

On 4 December 2023, in San Matias, Francisco Morazan, four heavily armed men arrived at a man's house, forcibly took him out of his home and then shot and killed him. The victim was found dead with multiple gunshot wounds about 50 meters from his house. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 December 2023 (between 4 - 5 December), in Lepaterique, Francisco Morazan, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands and feet tied in the El Campo neighborhood. The victim was kidnapped from his home one day before he was found dead. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Marcala, La Paz, residents of several local communities blocked traffic and burned tires on the main road of the municipality in demonstration demanding the reparation of this land communication route.
On 4 December 2023, in Lucea, Hanover, several armed men shot and killed a man riding a bicycle along the Barbary Hill main road. The shooters fled the scene on foot. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, in the morning, residents from the Greendale community held a protest with banners to decry roads deplorable conditions. Protesters blocked the roadway with debris, wood, and a parked car as they demanded the authorities to fix it.

On 4 December 2023, in Tijuana, Baja California, a woman who is a municipal police agent from Cerro Colorado was shot and killed when she was travelling in her personal vehicle after going out from work by two armed men on a motorcycle and a vehicle in Colonia Los Alamos. 1 fatality.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, a man was killed and the body was found gagged, covered with a blanket and signs of violence in colonia Mariano Matamoros Norte. 1 fatality.
Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, a woman was killed and her body was found wrapped in plastic bags, strangled and with a message next to her. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Tijuana, Baja California, students of the Lazaro Cardenas federal high school held a protest to denounce irregularities by the school authorities related to the management of school's resources.

On 4 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, carriers of the defunct Route 57 held a protest to demand a dialogue with the Ministry of Mobility (Semovi). The protesters denounced irregularities and lack of inclusion to the new projects.
On 4 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, several armed individuals shot and killed a man walking on the street in Colonia San Pedro de los Pinos. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, residents of Xoco protested and blocked the Real de Mayorazgo against a recent ruling related to a program that would affect the city in terms of environmental issues, water, housing development and mobility, and requested the reinstatement of the public consultation process.
On 4 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, people held a protest against the lack of water service.
On 4 December 2023, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a person was shot and killed by two armed men in colonia Los Limones. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a group of pensioners and retirees from the Ministry of Public Security and the State Attorney General's Office blocked Avenida Miguel Aleman to demand payment of their pension.
On 4 December 2023, in Hueyitlalpan, Guerrero, parents of the Nicolas Bravo kindergarten blocked the Chilpancingo-Chilapa highway to demand the assignment of a basic teacher for 23 minors.
On 4 December 2023, in Epazoyucan, Hidalgo, a man was held and beaten up by residents from barrio de Arriba after he robbed a wallet.
Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Tlaquepaque, Jalisco, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a blanket in Colonia Los Puestos. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Naucalpan de Juarez, Mexico, residents of Colonia Independencia held a protest against the annual religious fair in honor of La Guadalupana as they were not consulted in the decision.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found close to his home. The victim was identified as a collaborator of the State Prosecutor of the State of Mexico. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Mexico); CNTE: National Coordination of Education Workers
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Morelia, Michoacan, a hundred teachers of the National Coordination of Education Workers (CNTE) blocked Avenida Periodismo. The motive of the protest is unknown.
On 4 December 2023, in Benito Juarez, Nuevo Leon, a man was shot and killed by two armed men in colonia Los Cometas. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Chignautla, Puebla, taxi drivers held a protest at the entrance to the city against the presence of pirate taxi units. The protesters accused unfair competition from unauthorized taxis.
Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, a woman was killed and her body was found with a gunshot to her head and a message next to her. 1 fatality.

source: Borderland Beat; La Jornada; La Silla Rota
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Guasave, Sinaloa, two young men were stripped naked and forced to walk as punishment for selling electronic cigarettes. The young people were forced by hooded men (likely gang members) who also beat them with wooden boards (tableados). The event was recorded on video and shared on social networks.

On 4 December 2023, in Hermosillo, Sonora, former daycare teachers staged a sit-in outside the Victim's Attention office to demand federal authorities to recognize them as victims and access to a lifetime pension for physical and psychological injuries. The teachers worked in a daycare that burned down in 2009.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Llera de Canales, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals after they shot at the police station. There were no casualties.

On 4 December 2023, in Heroica Matamoros, Tamaulipas, a man from Colonia Palmares de Las Brisas was held and beaten up by the residents after he was accused of showing his private parts to children and tried to force them into his home.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, students and teachers held a 'Second Caravan for Inclusion' within the framework of the International Day of People with Disabilities to asked for greater inclusion.

assoc_actor_1: SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labor Group (Panama)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Panama City, Panama, members of the United People for Life Alliance gathered in front of the Ministry of Labor to protest against the closure of SUNTRACS's bank accounts. They also protested against its leaders at the Savings Bank and demanded that the commission that will oversee the closure of Mineria Panama be integrated by the employees to guarantee an orderly process and protect their interests.

source: Loop News Trinidad and Tobago; Trinidad and Tobago Guardian
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Manzanilla, Sangre Grande, in the morning, two men, armed with a cutlass, entered a property by force on the Plum Road and attacked man at his bedroom, seriously injuring him. The victim claimed not to know the perpetrators, whose motivations remain unknown. The attackers fled the scene. 1 injured.
On 4 December 2023, in Santa Rosa (Capital, La Pampa), members of the Press Union (SIPREN) protested at the Municipal Radio over the precarity in which the radio's journalists work.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Viedma (Adolfo Alsina, Rio Negro), Members of the Association of State Workers (ATE) protested against the current national administration for failing to comply with permanent contracts for state workers and low salaries. They also rejected economic adjustments and layoffs planned by the next government.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in San Carlos de Bariloche (Bariloche, Rio Negro), members of the Association of State Workers (ATE) protested against the current administration for failing to comply with permanent contracts for state workers and low salaries. They also rejected economic adjustments and layoffs planned by the next government.

assoc_actor_1: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labor Group (Argentina)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in General Roca (Rio Negro), members of the Association of State Workers (ATE) protested in front of the Ministry of Labor headquarters against the current administration for failing to comply with permanent contracts for state workers and low salaries. They also rejected economic adjustments and layoffs planned by the next government.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), a member of a drug trafficking group exchanged fire with military police during a police patrol in the Muca neighborhood. The drug trafficker was killed. Police seized a firearm and ammunition. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Manaus - West Zone (Amazonas), there was a shoot-out between rival drug trafficking groups in the Taruma neighborhood. A man was injured during the clash, but it is not known if he was a civilian or a gang member. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Manaus - Central West Zone (Amazonas), armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Redencao neighborhood. Police believe the victim was killed by drug traffickers due to a drug debt. 1 fatality.

source: Bnews (Brazil); Folha do Estado da Bahia; G1; Portal Chico Sabe Tudo
notes: On 4 December 2023, near Cachoeira (Bahia), a group of unidentified suspects blew up an armored car in the BR-101 highway during a robbery. The suspects escaped. One of the employees in the vehicle suffered non-life threatening injuries to his arm. There were no fatalities.

source: Bnews (Brazil); Folha do Estado da Bahia
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Capuchinhos neighbourhood. The victim was working cleaning vehicles on the street at the moment of the attack. The suspects arrived on a motorcycle and shot him. The suspects escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Bnews (Brazil); Folha do Estado da Bahia
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Feira de Santana (Bahia), a group of eight armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Campo Limpo neighbourhood. The suspects broke into the victim's house and proceeded to lock his family in a room and tortured him. The suspects then killed the man and escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Vitoria (Espirito Santo), drug traffickers exchanged fire with military police in the Tabuazeiro neighborhood. One drug trafficker was injured and later arrested, and a teenage boy was injured during the clash. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Aparecida do Taboado (Mato Grosso do Sul), three armed individuals stabbed, killed and decapitated a man. The man was negotiating a car in exchange for drugs with the trio, an argument began preceding the attack. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Governador Valadares (Minas Gerais), three drug traffickers invaded private residences in the Jardim do Trevo neighborhood looking for a teenage boy. The boy was not found, so the trio shot and killed a random civilian. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 4 December 2023, in Juiz de Fora (Minas Gerais), federal police seized 1.8 tons of marijuana hidden in a truck during an inspection on the BR-267 highway. One person was arrested.

On 4 December 2023, in Uberaba (Minas Gerais), armed individuals in two cars killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Recreio dos Bandeirantes neighborhood. The victim had a police record for homicide. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Redencao (Para), three armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Jardim America III sector. Police believe the attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
assoc_actor_2: FUNAI: National Indigenous Foundation; Indigenous Group (Brazil)
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Sao Felix do Xingu (Para), armed individuals exchanged fire with federal police and civil servants with the National Indigenous Foundation (FUNAI) during an operation to curb illegal occupation in the Apyterewa Indigenous reserve. One servant was shot and injured. The area where the attack occurred is being illegally exploited by large-scale farming. There were no fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Cabedelo (Paraiba), three unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Camboinha neighbourhood. The suspects broke into an apartment and shot the victim 10 times (likely an execution). The suspects escaped. Motivations for the attack are unknown. A portion of drug was found in the apartment. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Maringa (Parana), five armed individuals exchanged fire with military police. All five suspects were killed. At least three of them had a police record for drug trafficking. 5 fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Recife (Pernambuco), unidentified armed and hooded individuals shot and killed two men and injured one in the Pina neighbourhood. One of the killed men had a criminal record for drug trafficking. The other fatal victim also had a criminal record (charges unspecified). The third victim was passing by at the moment of the shooting and was accidently shot and injured. Circumstances of the event are unknown. The suspects escaped. 2 fatalities.

On 4 December 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), unknown individuals shot and killed a man in the Porto Centro neighbourhood. The victim was a drug user and had a criminal record for illegal possession of weapons and domestic violence. There is no information about the perpetrators. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Boa Vista (Roraima), military police went to the Carana neighborhood to arrest a member of a drug trafficking group. The gang member was killed during the intervention. The police claimed fire was exchanged, but witnesses of the event stated only the police opened fire. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Montevideo (Montevideo), court workers protested in front of the Supreme Court of Justice (SCJ) to demand the removal of the general director of Administrative Services for workplace harassment. The Association of Judicial Officials of Uruguay (AFJU), the Association of Judicial Clerks of Uruguay (ADAJU), the Association of Public Defenders of Uruguay (ADEPU), the Association of Judicial Informatics of Uruguay (ASIJU); the Association of Forensic Doctors of Uruguay (AMFU) and the Association of Psychologists of the ITF of Uruguay (APITFU) joined the demonstration.

On 4 December 2023, in Barcelona (Anzoategui), a group of demonstrators, including health workers, representatives of the Anzoategui state National Public Health Workers' Union (SUPEPSAS), and other healthcare unionists, protested to demand the liberation of the Secretary of the SINTRASALUD Health Workers' Union, arrested recently after voicing criticism over working conditions at the Luis Razetti Hospital, and to call for trade union autonomy, and the cessation of threats and intimidation towards unionists. They gathered outside the Barcelona Palace of Justice. The unionist was liberated two days later.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Maracay (Aragua), a group of students of the UNEFA University protested to demand justice for the female student killed by other fellow students in unclear circumstances, and to demand additional campus security.

On 4 December 2023, in Valencia (Carabobo), Carabobo state police forces shot and killed an unidentified crime group suspect, during an armed clash with two of them in the Parque Valencia Avenue. The suspects were travelling on a motorcycle when they spotted the police unit, and opened fire on the officers. The passenger was injured in the gunfire, and pronounced dead in hospital; the driver of the motorcycle managed to escape. The deceased was linked to homicide, and theft, and was being sought for the killing of his partner two days earlier. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), two unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed a woman, a merchant, in an attack in the San Martin market. According to witnesses, the target of the attack was a man who was being chased by the suspects. The man, another worker at the market, sought refuge by the victim's shop, and these opened fire on those premises, killing the woman. It is thought that the targeted man escaped unscathed. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 4 December 2023, in Duaca (Lara), a group of public transport workers protested against the presence of unlicensed transport workers which, according to the protesters, steal clients from them, reducing their income. Additionally, they protested against the difficulties they find in refueling. The demonstrators blocked the Intercomunal Barquisimeto - Duaca Avenue. PNB police forces were present but there was no intervention.

Around 4 December 2023 (as reported), in Carora (Lara), several unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed a man, in an attack in the Barrio Nuevo neighborhood. The suspects intercepted the victim, and shot him multiple times without any further interaction before fleeing. The authorities suggest the killing could be a settling of scores. 1 fatality.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Sucre state (coded to Cumana), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to housing.

source: OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
notes: On 4 December 2023, in Tachira state (coded to San Cristobal), demonstrators protested with unspecified demands on issues related to housing.

assoc_actor_1: DISK: Confederation of Progressive Trade Unions of Turkey; Labor Group (Turkey); Journalists (Turkey); HEDEP: Peoples' Equality and Democracy Party; Government of Turkey (2016-)
notes: On 4 December 2023, protesters staged a demonstration in front of the courthouse in Yenisehir, Diyarbakir, to call for solidarity with imprisoned journalists. Representatives of DISK and HEDEP (including MPs) attended the protest.

assoc_actor_1: DISK: Confederation of Progressive Trade Unions of Turkey; Labor Group (Turkey); TGS: Journalists Union of Turkey; Journalists (Turkey)

On 4 December 2023, farmers blocked the road with their tractors in Zupanja, voicing their dissatisfaction with the lack of governmental measures to assist them in dealing with swine influenza.

On 4 December 2023, representatives of Slovakian labor unions of truck drivers continued their blockade of the border crossing point with Ukraine in Vysne Nemecke, declaring solidarity with their Polish counterparts. The Polish activists have been blocking the Poland-Ukraine border for several days, criticizing allegedly unfair economic competition.

On 4 December 2023, unionized truck drivers for the 28th day blocked with their vehicles the border crossing point with Ukraine in Hrebenne. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight.

On 4 December 2023, unionized truck drivers for the 28th day blocked with their vehicles the border crossing point with Ukraine in Korczowa. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight. Unionized farmers supported them, voicing similar demands.

On 4 December 2023, non-medical staff of the county emergency hospital protested in Buzau, demanding wage increases. Medical workers joined the protest.
On 4 December 2023, tens of police staff protested in Constanta, demanding better planning of their working shifts and better staffing.

On 4 December 2023, around 50 Jewish community members demonstrated in front of the Israeli embassy in Hellerup, Hovedstaden, to oppose the ongoing Israeli offensive in Gaza and to call for a permanent ceasefire.
On 4 December 2023, people demonstrated in Norrebro, Copenhagen, to oppose the ongoing Israeli offensive in Gaza and to show support and solidarity with the people of Palestine.

On 4 December 2023, small retail shop owners protested at the Bulak market in Tokmok city of Chui region against the new tax regime requiring mandatory usage of cash register machines by small businesses demanding that the authorities allow retailers to operate under business patent license.

On 4 December 2023, small retail shop owners protested outside the Jayyl district administration in the town of Kara-Balta in Chui region against mandatory usage of cash register machines by small businesses demanding that the Kyrgyz government allow retailers to operate without cash register devices.

On 4 December 2023, small retail shop owners protested at the Dordoy Motors auto parts market near Oktyabr district in Bishkek city against the new tax regime and mandatory usage of cash register machines demanding that the authorities allow small businesses to operate under patent license.

On 4 December 2023, residents of Raimbek batyr neighborhood gathered outside their homes in the village of Ashibulak in Ile district of Almaty region in protest of bad roads, lack of access to public transportation, unaffordable cost of power supply and other social issues in the area calling for the authorities to resolve their grievances.

On 4 December 2023, about 5 relatives of Xinjiang native ethnic Kazakh citizens of China protested outside the Chinese Consulate near Almaly district of Almaty city against imprisonment of their relatives demanding that the Chinese authorities release their family members from prison.

On 4 December 2023, residents of Stepnoye, Leskhoz and Shmelev Log villages gathered outside the local pig farm near Oskemen district of the city of Ust-Kamenogorsk in East Kazakhstan region in protest of its operation due to concerns for public health in the area demanding that the authorities relocate the farm away from the villages.

On 4 December 2023, Azerbaijani sniper fired in the direction of Armenian military positions near Bardzruni, Vayots Dzor region, as a result of which an Armenian serviceman was killed. The Ministry of Defense of Azerbaijan refuted this report.

On 4 December 2023, members of the Hayaqve civil initiative protested in front of the National Assembly in Yerevan, Armenia, calling the State Legal Committee to vote positively for the draft law presented by the civil initiative in which case it will be included in the agenda of the National Assembly's session on 5 December.

On 4 December 2023, tens of Roma rioters from 2 rival families rallied outside Nafplio hospital in solidarity with 2 injured people - one from each faction - following an armed clash in a Roma camp. The rioters continued to clash outside the hospital, where shots were fired again. There was one injury. Strong police forces were at the scene, but requested further reinforcements.

On 4 December 2023, low wage public sector workers rallied outside the presidential palace and marched to the finance ministry in Nicosia carrying signs reading 'fair compensation for fair work'. They were organized by their union Isotita that said the high cost of living had driven low-paid workers to their limits.

On 4 December 2023, members of the AAP staged protests across Karnataka state (coded to Bengaluru) demanding the INC-led state government and the BJP-led Union government to compensate farmers who were facing hardships due to a severe drought and crop loss.

On 4 December 2023, members of the AAP along with its women's wing staged a protest in front of Mini Vidhana Soudha in Mangaluru city (Dakshina Kannada, Karnataka) demanding the INC-led state government and the BJP-led Union government to compensate farmers who were facing hardships due to a severe drought and crop loss. Protesters also submitted a memorandum to the District Collector.

On 4 December 2023, members of employee unions gathered under the banner of All-India NPS Employee Federation and staged a candlelight protest march from Transport Chowk to the plaza at Sector in Chandigarh city demanding the re-implementation of the old pension scheme.

On 4 December 2023, over 1,500 employees and field staff of the Forest Development Corporation of Maharashtra (FDCM) held a protest outside office in Nagpur city (Maharashtra) against non-payment of 7th pay commission arrears.

On 4 December 2023, unidentified men, likely linked to local Balasahebanchi Shiv Sena leader based on a previous similar incident, attacked a farmer, a relative of a local Congress MLA who is the BSS leader's rival, with a knife in Sillod city (Aurangabad, Maharashtra) over likely political rivalry (based on his familial relation). Two assailants stabbed and injured the victim, following which the victim ran away. The minister denied the allegations that her brother and his supporters were behind the attack.

On 4 December 2023, as many as 250 residents observed a bandh (shutdown strike) and, held a march in Alandi town (Pune, Maharashtra) to protest the current process of appointment of trustees to the Alandi temple trust.

On 4 December 2023, hundreds of hut dwellers staged a protest in front of the double-bedroom houses in the Balasamudram locality within the Greater Warangal Municipal Corporation (GWMC) in Warangal city (Mancherial, Telangana) demanding the government to give them houses. On 4 December 2023, members of a Scheduled Caste (Dalit group) and a dominant caste group (likely General Caste Group) clashed with each other in Appanaickenpatti Pudur near Sulur town (Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu), after the dominant caste men harassed a Dalit youth by making casteist remarks.

On 4 December 2023, over 100 residents of Anbu Nagar in Ukkadam staged a protest at the Coimbatore City Municipal Corporation (CCMC) head office in Coimbatore city (Tamil Nadu) demanding the administration to shift the sewage treatment plant and garbage collection facility in their locality to another location. On 4 December 2023, over 100 residents staged a protest march from the Hoodi Railway Station to Ayappanagar in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka) demanding the civic administration to construct tarred roads and improve the infrastructure in the area. actor2: PLA: People's Liberation Army of Manipur
source: Free Press Journal (India); Hindustan Times; Indian Express; Telegraph (India); Times of India
notes: On 4 December 2023, an unidentified armed group engaged in a gun battle with PLA at Leithao village near Saibol (Tengnoupal, Manipur) which resulted in the death of 13 PLA cadres, amidst ongoing conflict between Meitei and Tribal communities. An armed group of about 24 members (suspected to have been PLA) was previously engaged in an armed clash with Myanmar's PDF in the Indo-Myanmar border, which resulted in a split of the members. One of the split groups entered India through the jungle route commonly used by armed groups, where they are suspected to have encountered another armed group, resulting in the killings. PLA claims that the clash occurred between PLA cadres on one side and Kuki assailants and Indian security forces on the other side. Leithao is a predominantly Kuki village and an unspecified number of residents fled the village due to concerns over safety.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: On 4 December 2023, unidentified Bangladeshi nationals attempting to smuggle cough syrup, armed with sharp weapons attacked BSF who responded with gunfire at Nargaon town (Uttar Dinajpur district, J&K). One Bangladeshi national was left injured while others managed to escape. 2 Bangladeshi nationals were killed, including the injured person who succumbed to his injuries.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Assam Rifles
notes: On 4 December 2023, armed Kuki assailants fired gunshots targeting the predominantly Meitei village of Pukhao Santipur (Imphal East, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. The Assam Rifles retaliated with gunshots and bomb possibly injuring one of the armed Kukis as blood stains were found in the site during a search operation the next morning. Local residents had already left the village before the armed clash because of the present conflict.

On 4 December 2023, one group fired at a person from another group who was a trader by profession at Bhulkai town (Uttar Dinajpur district, WB) over a dispute over a government plot of land. He was killed in the incident. Police later arrested one person.

On 4 December 2023, a group of unidentified armed men (likely Meitei based on the geography) attacked a civilian (likely Meitei based on the name) at his residence in Wangkhei Ningthem Pukhri Mapal in the Wangkhei area within Imphal city (Imphal East, Manipur) over unidentified reasons, amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. The civilian was threatened at gunpoint and was physically assaulted. No injuries.

Weapons seizure: On 4 December 2023, security forces arrested an active cadre of MNPF in Imphal West district (coded to Imphal, Imphal West, Manipur) and recovered one .38 Pistol along with one magazine loaded with two rounds of ammunition, two mobile phones, 15 receipt vouchers of MNPF organisation and 12 demand letters.

Defusal: On 4 December 2023, an army team defused a grenade planted by unidentified armed assailants found in the roof of a garage in Kapahtoli locality near the army cantonment in Kakopathar town (Tinsukia, Assam). This is few days after a powerful grenade exploded in the same locality.

Weapons seizure: On 4 December 2023, security forces recovered weapons at Kangpokpi town (Kangpokpi, Manipur) belonging to unidentified armed assailants (likely Kuki since it is a predominantly Kuki area) after a cordon and search operation amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Recovered weapons include one AK-56 Rifle with two magazines, one Single Barrel Rifle, one Chinese grenade, one mortar round, hundred rounds of AK-56 ammunition and seven fired cases of Single Barrel Rifle.

Weapons seizure: On 4 December 2023, security forces recovered weapons in an area between Nongshum and Khamenlok villages (Kangpokpi, Manipur) belonging to unidentified armed assailants after a cordon and search operation amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Recovered weapons include three SMG Carbines with three empty magazines, fifteen HE 36 hand grenades without detonator, six WP smoke grenades without detonator, eighteen 2' Mortar HE bombs and six 75 MK-2 detonators.

On 4 December 2023, volunteers of the Imagi Meira (Meitei women's body) protested outside the Manipur Assembly in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) demanding authorities to take action against the 10 Kuki MLAs who are advocating for separate administration of the Kuki-Zo communities amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. 2 of the members were allowed to meet the joint secretary after police intervened.

On 4 December 2023, vendor ladies (emas) (likely Meitei based on location and demand) protested by closing all shops and business establishments within the Khwairamband Keithel area in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) against the murder of the 13 Meiteis at Leithou village (coded separately) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state.

notes: On 3 December 2023, in Willikies, Saint Philip, in the morning, a police officer opened fire on a vehicle with a man and a woman inside, near Emerald Cove. No one was injured and only material damages were mentioned. The motivation for the shooting remains unknown. There were no casualties.

On 3 December 2023, in La Vigia, Dajabon, at least six Haitian border agents (Polifront) disrupted the commercial activity between Dominican and Haitian traders at an informal market run by Dominican merchants at the border area. It happened as the Polifront agents carried out an operation aiming at preventing contraband goods entering the Haitian territory. Dominican sources stated that the Haitian agents aggressed the merchants, fired tear gas, threw the merchants' goods into nearby mountains, and kicked others that were on the ground. Dominican authorities described the intervention as a provocation and a violation of its national sovereignty. The Haitian agents left the area as Dominican soldiers arrived. This happened as the Dominican-Haitian border closure persists.

On 3 December 2023, in Amatitlan, Guatemala, according to witnesses, several attackers shot and killed a man and injured a woman for no apparent reason in San Antonio neighborhood. No more detail is provided by the source. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in near Guatemala City, Guatemala, a man was killed and his charred body was found at the height of the route 23.4 to San Pedro Sacatepequez. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Pajapita, San Marcos, a man was killed and his charred body was found in an empty lot. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Usumatlan municipality, Zacapa, a man was killed and his charred body was found in an empty lot. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 December 2023, in Trou-du-Nord, Nord-Est, overnight, citizens held a demonstration on the National Road 6 demanding the reopening of the Haitian-Dominican border. Demonstrators burned tires and parked vehicles on the road.

Around 3 December 2023 (weekend of), near Casale, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals kidnapped four civilians travelling in a mini-bus at the height of the Morne a Cabrit peak. Among the abducted, there was a former political candidate for the Boucan Carre commune. There is no further information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Mariani, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several gang members as they carried out anti-gang operations in the commune. The police recovered a heavy machine which had been stolen by the gangsters. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: Property destruction: On 3 December 2023, in Saint-Louis du Sud, Sud, police forces seized more than 17 tones of marijuana during an anti-drugs operation at the house of a man who managed to escape. A Jamaican citizen was arrested.

On 3 December 2023, in Las Vegas, Santa Barbara, unidentified armed hitmen shot and killed a moto taxi driver. The victim was carrying out his work duties when he was attacked. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 3 December 2023, in Yoro, Yoro, several armed individuals shot and killed a man outside his own home. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Kingston, Kingston, a man was killed (methods unknown) and his partially burned body was found on abandoned on a track in the Smokey Vale neighbourhood. Perpetrators and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 3 December 2023, in Ensenada, Baja California, workers from the KH Yellow company held a protest in front of the 260 degrees restaurant to demand payment of settlement after they were fired.

On 3 December 2023, in Ensenada, Baja California, mothers of people who are missing held a protest to demand justice and the search of their relatives. The event was held during the visit of a candidate for presidency.

Non-violent activity: On 3 December 2023, in Chicomuselo, Chiapas, members of the Catholic organization 'Pueblo Creyente' with pastoral agents and local perishers was detained and interrogated by members of El Maiz group, which is linked to the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), when they were travelling around Chachahual neighborhood.

On 3 December 2023, in Chichabantelja, Chiapas, around 80 residents from Tunapaz arrived to the community. Some even with firearms and started shooting in the air. They opened a ditch in the road and cut off the electricity service of the Chichabantelja community members whom many of them are members of the Movement in Defense of Life and Territory (Modevite). The rioters also threw stones and sticks at their neighbors resulting in at least eight indigenous people injured. The rioters also held four members of the Mofevite. The event is related to a lack of agreement for the distribution of the water from a spring located in Chic'habantelja.

On 3 December 2023, close to Palenque, Chiapas, an armed group intercepted a man driving close to the archaeological area and killed the man. The victim was identified as alias El Dani who was the head of organized crime in Comalcalco. 1 fatality.

On 3 December 2023, in El Sauz, Chihuahua, the Juarez Cartel and the Sinaloa Cartel engaged in an armed clash which resulted in the death of two people. Members of the Sinaloa Cartel were on their way to attack another group (La Linea) and encountered the Juarez Cartel. Two people died as a result. 2 fatalities.

On 3 December 2023, in Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua, more than 100 Mexican and international artists held a protest against femicides, violence, abuse and other problems suffered by migrants. The activists painted 70 murals as part of the event called 'Under the bridge' against violence targeting migrants.

On 3 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, hundreds of motorcyclists in a rally from Monument de la Revolucion to celebrate Motorcyclist Day. During the event women demanded an end to violence against women.

On 3 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, dozens of people marched from the Angel of Independence to the Ahuehuete roundabout to demand an end to the attacks against the Palestinian people. The protesters asked Mexico to end diplomatic relations with Israel and asked for a ceasefire.
On 3 December 2023, in Torreon, Coahuila, people marched as part of International Disability Day. The people demanded greater inclusion of people with disabilities.
On 3 December 2023, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, people marched as part of International Disability Day. The people demanded greater inclusion of people with disabilities.
On 3 December 2023, in Gomez Palacio, Durango, people marched as part of International Disability Day. The people demanded greater inclusion of people with disabilities.
On 3 December 2023, in Lerdo, Durango, people marched as part of International Disability Day. The people demanded greater inclusion of people with disabilities.

Around 3 December 2023, in Celaya, Guanajuato, five students were killed and their bodies were found inside a vehicle close to the University of Guanajuato (UG) on the Celaya-Salvatierra campus. Three men were identified as brothers and the cousin of the former head of the National Sistem for Family Development DIF and former PAN councilor and of the former trustee. 5 fatalities.

On 3 December 2023, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, people held a protest to demand justice for the killing of the activist, Adolfo Enriquez Vanderkam (coded separately) who had denounced the increasing insecurity in the state.

On 3 December 2023, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, for the second day, workers held a protest at the facilities of the Christmas and New Year Fair and started a strike after the Secretariat of Agrarian, Territorial and Urban Development (Sedatu) failed to pay them three weeks of wages.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: On 3 December 2023, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents from Omiltemi gathered and blocked their pumps that supply water to the municipality to demand a compensation since they have not received any benefits for 50 years. The event was recorded in a video an delivered to the media and broadcasted on the networks.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Zacacoyuca, Guerrero, two people were killed and their bodies were found inside plastic bags on the Chilpancingo - Iguala highway. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Ajacuba municipality, Hidalgo, a person was killed and the body was found with the hands and feet tied up with gunshot wounds in El Jaguey community. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Via Libre; La Silla Rota
notes: Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in San Jose Atlan, Hidalgo, a person was killed and the body was found with signs of torture and naked. 1 fatality.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Guadalajara, Jalisco, a man was killed and his body was found with the hands tied up in colonia Lomas de Polanco. 1 fatality.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Morelia, Michoacan, a man was killed and his body was found partially burned on the Ciudad Jardin-Rancheria Las Flores road. 1 fatality.

notes: On 3 December 2023, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, a ministerial police officer who was in a police investigation over drug dealing was shot and killed by armed individuals who ran away on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.

On 3 December 2023, in Santa Maria Xonacatepec, Puebla, a criminal member was kidnapped by five members of La Barredora gang in his house. He was beaten up and forced into the trunk of a car. According to relatives of the victim, the perpetrators stated to be part of the La Barredora gang that operates for the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG). The event was recorded in video. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 3 December 2023, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, 150 beach vendors requested the intervention of the president Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador after the Ministry of Environment and Resources limited their working area.

On 3 December 2023, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, railway workers held a protest outside the CRIT Sinaloa during the visit of the President to ask for his intervention to their demands. Details on the specific demands were not reported.
On 3 December 2023, in Hermosillo, Sonora, relatives and friends of members of the Network of Associations for Disability held a march to demand for greater inclusion for people with disabilities.
Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), in Huimanguillo, Tabasco, an armed group opened fire at two men. Both men died as a result. The attack is being linked to the sale of drugs. 2 fatalities.

On 3 December 2023, in Huimanguillo, Tabasco, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. Three men were killed. According to the investigations, the event is most related to drug dealing. 3 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 3 December 2023, in Heroica Matamoros, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police in Colonias Marte R. Gomez, Virgilio Garza Ruiz and fraccionamiento Marte Rita Prince. One police officer was injured.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 3 December 2023, in Veracruz, Veracruz, nearly 500 people gathered in the central area to march to commemorate the International Day of People with Disabilities. The protesters asked for a greater inclusion.

notes: On 3 December 2023, in Cecilio Teran, Veracruz, a man who was working at a phytosanitary verification post was shot and injured by two armed men.

On 3 December 2023, in Panama City, Panama, people gathered in the area of the Ministry of Environment to demand a complete stop of mining activity in the country. The report indicates that fences were set up behind the Faculty of Social Education of Universidad de las Americas at the protesters' arrival and that the police was present. The protesters also installed tents where they aim to stay until they are heard.

On 3 December 2023, in Cayey, Cayey, two armed men in a moving vehicle opened fire on the two occupants of a car on the PR-184 Road, at the height of the Guavate neighbourhood, killing an elderly man and injuring his female partner (drive-by). The motivation for the shooting is unknown. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

source: El Nuevo Dia (Puerto Rico); El Vocero de Puerto Rico
notes: On 3 December 2023, in Manati, Manati, several armed men in a moving vehicle opened fire on a house in the Boquillas neighbourhood (drive-by). A four-year-old boy who was at the yard was shot and injured. Several vehicles were damaged by the bullets. The motivation for the shooting is unknown. 1 injured.

On 3 December 2023, in Tunapuna, Tunapuna Piarco, overnight, an armed man shot and killed a man on Upper Fairley Street and was seen fleeing the scene with another individual (both believed to be implicated in the shooting). Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 December 2023, in Macapa (Amapa), three armed individuals invaded a private residence in the Pacoval neighborhood, shot and killed a man. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 December 2023, in Manaus - East Zone (Amazonas), an armed individual who arrived with an accomplice shot and killed a barber inside his commercial establishment in the Mutirao neighborhood. Before opening fire, the perpetrator asked if the victim belonged to a drug trafficking group, which he denied. Family members of the deceased believe he was killed by mistake, but locals claim the deceased used to tell people he was a member of the PCC. 1 fatality.

Police seized firearms, ammunition and drugs portioned for sale. 3 fatalities.

On 3 December 2023, in Salvador - Itapua (Bahia), a group of local residents protested in the Jardim das Margaridas neighbourhood against the killing of a man by unknown individuals a few days before (coded separately). Family members of the victim took part on the protest and demanded justice.

The officers were searching for the suspect of the killing of an off-duty officer on the same day (coded separately). During the clash, one military police officer and both suspects were shot and killed. One suspect escaped. 3 fatalities.

Both armed clashes took place during an operation to find the suspects of killing an off-duty military police officer earlier on the same day (coded separately). Police seized a firearm, ammunition and drugs. 2 fatalities.
On 3 December 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), people set up camp in front of the Legislative Assembly in a protest to demand the conclusion of a public tender.

On 3 December 2023, in Divinopolis (Minas Gerais), a drug trafficker beat up and injured a woman in the Manoel Valinhas neighborhood due to a drug debt. The victim was a drug user. The drug trafficker was arrested. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 3 December 2023, in Belem (Para), unknown individuals vandalized an Umbanda religious site on Mosqueiro island. The site coordinators believe it was a case of religious intolerance.

On 3 December 2023, in Doutor Pedrinho (Santa Catarina), people blocked the SC-477 highway to demand better paved roads. The protesters staged a birthday party to mark a year since potholes opened in the highway and have not been fixed.

Elections/referendum: On 3 December 2023, in Distrito Capital state (coded to Caracas - Libertador), the consultative referendum in support of Venezuela's claims to the Esequibo territories currently belonging to Guyana took place. It consisted of five questions regarding specific aspects of Venezuela's claims, including the creation of the Guayana Esequiba state, and its own regional government, and conceding its inhabitants Venezuelan citizenship. According to the National Electoral Council, 10.5 million Venezuelans, roughly a 50% turnout, voted in favor of the annexation of these territories.

Then, the protesters, including students of Hiroshima University, staged a sit-in in front of the dome to express solidarity with Palestine.

admin1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
source: ABS-CBN; CNN; GMA News; Manila Bulletin; Manila Times; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Star; Rappler; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 3 December 2023, 4 people were killed during the explosion of an IED planted by suspected Islamic State militants or Dawlah Islamiyah - Maute Group militants, inside a gym at Mindanao State University in Marawi City (Lanao del Sur, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). At least 40 individuals were wounded. A Catholic mass, attended mostly by students, was being held when the IED exploded. Authorities said that the attack could be in retaliation for recent military actions targeting Dawlah Islamiyah (DI) and Abu Sayyaf Group. They are considering the possibility of a retaliatory act by the DI - Maute Group, prompted by the firefight between the military and Dawlah Islamiyah (DI) that led to 11 militant fatalities on 1 December 2023, and given also that the Maute Group is present in Lanao del Sur. Meanwhile, the Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the explosion through their Telegram channels, but authorities are still validating the group's claim. Authorities arrested one of the suspects, whom they believe is an accomplice of the one who planted the bomb, and are looking into the possible affiliation of the arrested suspect with the Maute group. Authorities also said that they identified 2 persons of interest in the bombing who are affiliated with the Maute Group.

On 3 December 2023, dozens of people gathered to protest with placards on Ketagalan boulevard in front of the Presidential Palace in Taipei City - Zhongzheng district (Taipei City). They opposed a planned policy that would allow as many as 100,000 workers from India to enter Taiwan. Some feared stagnant wages.

On 3 December 2023, farmers blocked the road with their tractors in Zupanja, voicing their dissatisfaction with the lack of governmental measures to assist them in dealing with swine influenza.

On 3 December 2023, representatives of Slovakian labor unions of truck drivers continued their blockade of the border crossing point with Ukraine in Vysne Nemecke, declaring solidarity with their Polish counterparts. The Polish activists have been blocking the Poland-Ukraine border for several days, criticizing allegedly unfair economic competition.

On 3 December 2023, ORP activists gathered for a rally near the Presidential palace in Warsaw, protesting against alleged violations of constitutional practices and rights by the president and the currently ruling PiS party.

On 3 December 2023, unionized truck drivers, supported by farmers, continued their blockade of the border crossing point with Ukraine near Medyka. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight.

On 3 December 2023, Ukrainian activists and cargo drivers blocked a road near Zamosc with their cars, protesting against the ongoing blockades between Poland and Ukraine and demanding free passage for Ukrainian cars across the border.

On 3 December 2023, unionized truck drivers for the 27th day blocked with their vehicles the border crossing point with Ukraine in Dorohusk. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight.

On 3 December 2023, unionized truck drivers for the 27th day blocked with their vehicles the border crossing point with Ukraine in Hrebenne. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight.

On 3 December 2023, unionized truck drivers for the 27th day blocked with their vehicles the border crossing point with Ukraine in Korczowa. They were condemning allegedly unfair conditions for Ukrainian transport and trade companies and demanded stronger state oversight. Unionized farmers supported them, voicing similar demands.
On 3 December 2023, Ukrainian military shelled with 5 artillery rounds the village of Shchetinovka (Belgorodskiy, Belgorod). No casualties.
On 3 December 2023, Ukrainian military shelled with 1 mortar round the village of Lozovaya Rudka (Borisovskiy, Belgorod). No casualties.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked a presumably non-ethnically Russian man in St. Petersburg (Admiralteyskiy, Saint Petersburg). They beat him up and struck him with a knife. The group said this attack was an act of vengeance for an attack that happened on December 1 in the city when a man from Tajikistan struck an 8th-grader with a knife.
On 3 December 2023, people staged a torchlight procession in Hedemora, Dalarna, to oppose the planned closure of two local schools.
On 3 December 2023, environmental activists from the Emergency Brake movement staged a protest performance in Copenhagen calling an end to motorway construction in the country.

On 3 December 2023, about 30 residents of Podstepnoye village near Algabas township of Terekti district in West Kazakhstan region gathered outside their homes in protest of bad roads in the area demanding that the authorities fix roads in the village.

assoc_actor_1: PSE: Pancyprian Peace Council; Protesters (Palestine); Government of Palestine (1994-) Palestinian National Authority; Greek Ethnic Group (Cyprus); Turkish Ethnic Group (Cyprus); POGO: Womens Movement; Women (Cyprus); AKEL: Progressive Party of Working People; Cyprus Green Party
notes: On 3 December 2023, over 1,000 demonstrators from across Cyprus rallied in Nicosia in solidarity with the Palestinians. The protesters marched holding signs reading 'Hydrocarbons and blood' referring to the agreement between Cyprus, Greece, Israel, and the US on energy exploitation. The organizers, totalling 38 Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot organizations, demanded an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and the provision of humanitarian aid among other issues. Members of the women's movement POGO unfurled a banner outside the Israeli embassy reading 'How many more dead children?' The head of the Pancyprian Peace Council, the leader of AKEL, the ambassador of Palestine in Cyprus, the leader of the Cyprus Green Party held speeches or made statements. The demonstrators chanted slogans against Israel, against the United States, and against the President of Cyprus, accusing him of supporting genocide.

On 3 December 2023, on International Day of Persons with Disabilities, protesters rallied in Thessaloniki to highlight the problems they face with underfunding, understaffing, and the commercialization of the public health and welfare sector.

actor1: Police Forces of Cyprus (2023-) Port and Marine Police
notes: Other: On 3 December 2023, early in the morning, Port and Marine police rescued 101 irregular migrants on a vessel in distress 17 nautical miles off the Coast of Cape Greco. They had set sail from Lebanon until their vessel, which had also mechanical failure, had started capsizing because it was overcrowded. 3 police vessels were required for the rescue and transfer of the migrants to Ayia Napa.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; Labor Group (India)
notes: On 3 December 2023, hundreds of people including members of the CITU staged a protest at the Freedom Park in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka) against the attack on Gaza amidst the ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine. Protesters condemned the 'Israeli aggression' in Gaza and held placards to mark their protest.

On 3 December 2023, members of farmer organizations gathered under the banner of the Joint Sugarcane Struggle Committee and staged 'Day 3' of their dharna (sit-in) protest along one side of the Jalandhar-Pathankot National Highway in Mukerian city (Hoshiarpur, Punjab) against the state government for failing to increase the price of sugarcane to the desired amount, and also demanded compensation for crop damage, among others.

On 3 December 2023, two unidentified car-borne assailants opened fire at a BJP leader (Verka Mandal president) which hit his car near a bridge in the Vallah area (Amritsar, Punjab) for unidentified reasons. No injuries were reported.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), members of a Muslim family assaulted and vandalized the house of a Hindu man and a woman (the mother) at Vijay Nagar area's Abdul Hameed Colony in Ghaziabad city (Uttar Pradesh) in a suspected attempt to forcefully convert the Hindu man to Islam through marriage.

Property destruction: Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), unidentified assailants vandalized the statue of Dr. B. R. Ambedkar (a Dalit champion) in Veer Pura village (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh) for unidentified reasons.

On 3 December 2023, a few people assaulted a man after tying him upside down to a tree under the Dramandganj police station area (Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh) over suspicions of stealing a mobile phone. A video of the incident was circulated online. One accused was detained.

On 3 December 2023, members of the Hattee Yuva Vichar Manch staged a protest in Chandigarh city against the delay in the implementation of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) status to the Hattee community of the trans-Giri area of Sirmaur.

On 3 December 2023, the Anganwadi workers (community health workers, mostly women) under the aegis of Kolhapur District Anganwadi Workers Union blocked the gates of the district collectorate's office and sat on an indefinite strike outside the office in Kolhapur city (Maharashtra) over several demands like regular salary and increment in every six months.

On 3 December 2023, people belonging to the Kodava community (people belonging to the region of Kodagu) staged a protest during a talk at literary festival venue in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka) after the speaker made some comments about the Kodava community during the time of British rule in India. Protesters objected to the speaker's statements about members of the community collaborating with the British instead of the Indians.

On 3 December 2023, members of the National Federation of Blind (NFB), on International Day of Persons with Disabilities (IDPD), staged a 'Black Day' protest, raising slogans, in front of the Deputy Commissioner's (DC) office in Shimla city (Himachal Pradesh) against the on-fulfillment of their demands which include the provision of regular jobs, and improved advertisement of jobs, among others.

assoc_actor_2: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; Police Forces of India (2014-)
