There were a total of over 100 fatalities on the military side split across six events (3 days each in Mone town and Kawt Pyin village), coded as 16 in this event.

On 2 December 2023, unidentified gunmen shot a regime member in Qarfa town in rural Dara, injuring him. The victim is responsible for the arrest of many Qarfa town residents. There were no fatalities.
On 2 December 2023, unidentified gunmen attacked a QSD-affiliated checkpoint in Al-Hessan village in rural western Deir ez Zor. Casualties unknown.

On 2 December 2023, residents held a protest in Qarayya in rural As Sweida calling for freedom and in solidarity with protests in As-Sweida city.
On 2 December 2023, residents held a protest in As-Sweida city calling for freedom following the raiding of the Ba'ath building in the city and discovery of Ba'ath reports a day prior.

source: Al Mirbad; National Iraqi News Agency
notes: On 2 December 2023, unknown militants launched a rocket targeting the Dawa party Office in Basrah. Material damages only. There were no fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in Los Patios (Norte de Santander), for the second consecutive day, a group of detained teenagers staged riots inside the local juvenile detention center, denouncing mistreatment by the institution's staff. The rioters destroyed fences, doors, and burned mattresses. The mother of one of the detained individuals said that the riot started because a staff member confiscated a package of weed, after which one of the teenagers stabbed them with a knife. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Belford Roxo - Nova Aurora (Rio de Janeiro), military police shot and killed two teenage girls in the Novo Aurora neighborhood after an armed clash between drug traffickers and militiamen. The police says that when they arrived, one of the victims was already dead, while the other was found injured and was taken to hospital. However, witnesses and family members claim police arrived firing indiscriminate shots, which hit the victims. The police officer responsible for killing the girls is currently under investigation for ties with the militia. 2 fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in Chimore (Cochabamba), for the second consecutive day, transportation workers blocked the new highway to Cochabamba on N bridge as a demonstration to demand maintenance of the highway and a construction of an additional double lane.

On 2 December 2023, in Tunari (Cochabamba), for the second consecutive day, transportation workers blocked the new highway to Cochabamba as a demonstration to demand maintenance of the highway and a construction of an additional double lane.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Duque de Caxias (Rio de Janeiro), the military police exchanged fire with drug traffickers in the Barro Vermelho community, Pantanal neighborhood. Four suspects were shot and killed. 4 fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in Mesquita (Rio de Janeiro), three hooded armed men shot a man to death in front of a bar in the Jacutinga neighborhood. The victim was accompanied by two friends, who were not injured. Another source mentions that he was killed in front of his mother's house. Motivation and perpetrators unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in Neiva (Huila), around 2,000 students from the Surcolombiana University staged demonstrations, claiming that the institution is charging them the full tuition fee, despite the existence of a government project that guarantees free enrollment in undergraduate programs at universities.

actor1: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
notes: Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), between Caldono and Jambalo municipality (coded to Caldono, Cauca), members of the Dagoberto Ramos FARC dissident faction kidnapped an off-duty military soldier who was visiting relatives in the area. As a result of coordinated efforts between the local Indigenous guard, the Ombudsman's Office, and military soldiers, the man was released hours later.

On 2 December 2023, in the rural area of El Carmen De Bolivar (Bolivar), unidentified assailants shot and killed a man on a road that connects the San Rafael and El Cocuelo veredas. The victim's body was found on 3 December with tied hands, multiple gunshot wounds to the head, and signs of torture. There is no further information about the reasons or the perpetrators of the attack but the area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Ocana (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Cristo Rey neighborhood. There is no further information about the reasons or the perpetrators of the attack, but there is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Ocana (Norte de Santander), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the El Carmen neighborhood. The victim's mother was also injured in the attack. There is no further information about the reasons or the perpetrators of the attack, but there is presence of armed groups in the area. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Sincelejo (Sucre), unidentified assailants killed a man near the Cruz de Mayo CAI. There is no further information about the reasons or the perpetrators of the attack, however, the area is known for the presence of the Gulf Clan. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Women (Colombia); Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); JAC: Council of Communal Action
notes: On 2 December 2023, in the rural area of Solita municipality (Caqueta), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a female social leader and president of the Council of Communal Action of the Cusumbo vereda. In the area there is presence of members of the Second Marquetalia and the Carolina Ramirez FARC's dissident faction. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Peru); PM: Purple Party; Government of Peru (2022-)
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Lima - Lima District (Lima), members of the National Fight Coordinator (CNUL) and the Platform for democracy, unionized workers, members of citizens' organizations, and a congress member of Purple Party (PM) marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the resignation of president Dina Boluarte, the closure of congress and early presidential elections to be called.

On 2 December 2023, in Iquitos (Loreto), residents of Saposoa and Quinones streets in San Juan Bautista district captured and beat up a man who had robed an elderly woman. The man was forced to walk with bare feet to 9 de Octubre police station.

On 2 December 2023, in Pataz (La Libertad), illegal mining group members who are part of Tren de Aragua gang attempted to take control of La Poderosa mining facilities, took four miners as hostages, and injured private security officer. The officers attempted to remove them from the facilities and a clash with guns and explosives was held, in which nine people were killed and more than 30 workers injured. 9 fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in the New Providence Island (coded to Nassau), New Providence, at least five employees of a nightclub, including a security guard, attacked a US transgender woman for no apparent reason. The victim was stomped, punched, and kicked. The event was described as a hate crime.
On 2 December 2023, in San Marcos de Colon, Choluteca, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a moto taxi driver. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Olanchito, Yoro, members of the Citizen Opposition Block (BOC) marched in protest under the slogan 'Now or never' to protest against the government. The BOC has called for this penultimate mobilization of the year 2023 as part of its agenda of protests and citizen expression.

On 2 December 2023, in Savanna-la-Mar, Westmoreland, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a vendor man as he was about to set up his fruit stand at a market (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. The perpetrators fled the scene. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Tecate, Baja California, the former assistant to the mayor and current director of the municipal vehicle parking was shot and killed by an armed man inside a bar near the Municipal Presidency. Another man from the US was also injured. According to witnesses, the perpetrator ran away with an accomplice. Days after the killing, the CJNG left a blanked against the mayor referring to the killing of his former assistant and warning him of doing alliances with rival criminal groups. The message did not confirm the authorship of the attack. 1 fatality.
On 2 December 2023, in La Paz, Baja California Sur, workers from the Piojillo sports park and Parque Lineal held a protest against the lack of the payment of three weeks salary.

Property destruction: On 2 December 2023, in Altamirano, Chiapas, members of the August 14 self-defense group set fire to the camp where landowners from 108 communities had been holding a protest for four months. There were no casualties.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in Nueva Esperanza 1ra. Sec., Chiapas, an unknown number of people were killed and their human remains were found with narco-messages. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), around Pichucalco, Chiapas, an unknown number of people were killed and their human remains were found with narco-messages between Teapa and Pichucalco around El Azufre ranch. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 2 December 2023, in El Sauz, Chihuahua, there was an armed clash between armed individuals in Colonia Nuevo Delicias. One man was killed and two men were injured. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, people from Colonia Xoco held a protest behind Mitikah mall to demand better water services, claiming that since the construction of the mall they have suffered the lack of water.

On 2 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, tens of members of the People with Disabilities Movement (PCD) marched towards the Palace of Fine Arts as part of the International Day of People with Disabilities to demand decent work for people with disabilities. Different workers and lawyers also joined the march.

On 2 December 2023, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, at least 100 members of the People with Disabilities Movement (PCD) marched towards the Palace of Fine Arts as part of the International Day of People with Disabilities to demand decent work for people with disabilities.
Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a person was killed and the body was found wrapped in blankets in San Sebastian cemetery. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, around 200 workers held a protest at the facilities of the Christmas and New Year Fair and started a strike after the Secretariat of Agrarian, Territorial and Urban Development (Sedatu) failed to pay them three weeks of wages.

On 2 December 2023, in Tixtla de Guerrero, Guerrero, students from the Ayotzinapa Normal School took over the toll booth on the Tixtla-Chilpancingo highway to ask for money to carried out future mobilizations to demand justice for the 43 missing students from Iguala.

On 2 December 2023, in El Daxtha, Hidalgo, a man was shot and killed and a woman was injured by armed men who intercepted them on the Mexico-Laredo highway and escaped in three vehicles. The victim was a drug dealer. 1 fatality.
On 2 December 2023, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, unknown armed individuals opened fire at the facade of a home in Colonia El Dean. There were no casualties.

On 2 December 2023, in Morelia, Michoacan, people marched within the framework of World AIDS Day. The event was held with the purpose of remembering and paying tribute to the people who have lost their lives due to HIV. The participants also asked for better living conditions for people with aids. Members of the LGBTQ community participated in the event.

Property destruction: On 2 December 2023, in Uruapan, Michoacan, armed men shot at a warehouse and a truck in Colonia Revolucion near the old facilities of the Regional Prosecutor's Office of Justice. There were no casualties. According to the investigations, the event could be related to extortion.

On 2 December 2023, in Maria Lombardo de Caso, Oaxaca, the son of the mayor of Santiago Sochiapan in Veracruz state, was shot and killed when he was going out from a reunion by several armed men who ambushed him on the limits with Oaxaca. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: MULT: Movement of Triqui Unification and Struggle; Mixtec Indigenous Group (Mexico)
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Yosoyuxi Copala, Oaxaca, a member of the Movement of Triqui Unification and Struggle (MULT) from the Mixtec Indigenous Group was shot and killed and another one was also injured by unidentified armed individuals during an ambush. The MULT stated that the perpetrators are members of the MULTI group, however, this was not confirmed. 1 fatality.
Security measures: On 2 December 2023, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, 800 military officers were deployed to increase the security.
On 2 December 2023, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, workers from the Autonomous University of Sinaloa held a protest to demand the dismissal of the director.

On 2 December 2023, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, taxi drivers were outside the government officers demonstrating against granting permits for digital apps driver while local authorities discussed the granting of permits for drivers of digital platforms. There was a clash between taxi drivers and drivers from digital apps such as uber, with rioters beaten up at each other.
On 2 December 2023, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, dozens of residents of Astata held a protest against high electricity bills.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in Macuspana, Tabasco, two people were beaten up, handcuffed and left with their fingers cut off and a message. Both victims were alive and left injured. They were reported to have been previously kidnapped in Paraiso municipality.

On 2 December 2023, in Soto la Marina, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between members of Los Zetas vieja Escuela and Los Escorpions gangs when they tried to entered the city. Several vehicles were destroyed. An unknown number of gang members were reported killed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

notes: On 2 December 2023, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, more than 50 people marched to raise awareness about disability to commemorate the International Day of People with Disabilities. The protesters asked for a greater inclusion of people with disabilities.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in La Zacatecana, Zacatecas, a man was tortured and killed by members of a criminal group and his body was found. According to the report, the victim had been kidnapped. 1 fatality.

source: Loop News Trinidad and Tobago; Newsday Trinidad and Tobago
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Port of Spain, Port of Spain, in the morning, an unknown number of armed men in a moving vehicle shot and killed a man walking along Oxford Street (drive-by). The shooters fled the scene. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, near Craibas (Alagoas), two unidentified armed individuals shot and injured a man in a drive-by shooting in the Lagarto hamlet. The suspects were on a motorcycle when they shot the victim, who was also on a motorcycle. The suspects escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in Manaus - North Zone (Amazonas), armed individuals in a car forced a man out of the vehicle in the Cidade Nova neighborhood, shot and killed him. In the Novo Aleixo neighborhood, armed individuals in a car shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting. Authorship and motivation of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Coroa Vermelha (Santa Cruz Cabralia, Bahia), military police officers exchanged fire with drug traffickers in the Carajas neighbourhood. The officers went to the location after a report about the presence of armed individuals planning an attack and spotted a group of four armed suspects. A shoot out took place and one suspect was shot and killed. The others escaped. Police seized a firearm, ammunition, and drugs portioned for sale. 1 fatality.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), in Aurizona (Godofredo Viana, Maranhao), local residents demonstrated and burned down a backhoe, in a demonstration against the closure of the only road that connects the village to the rest of the region. The closure of the road took place due to waste landslide from the Arurizona mining company.

On 2 December 2023, in Nova Alvorada do Sul (Mato Grosso do Sul), locals beat up and injured a man suspected of stabbing his ex-wife. The suspect escaped, but died later during his arrest operation in a clash with police after police shot him when he refused to drop a knife. There were no fatalities.

On 2 December 2023, in Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais), an unknown armed individual shot and killed a man in the Mariano de Abreu neighborhood. The deceased had a police record for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.
On 2 December 2023, in Cava Grande district (Marlieria, Minas Gerais), four armed individuals shot and killed a man. The deceased had a police record for homicide and drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), an unidentified armed individual shot and killed a teenaged boy in a drive-by shooting in the Treze de Maio neighbourhood. The suspect escaped. Circumstances of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Bom Jesus (Piaui), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a drug trafficker in the Aeroporto neighbourhood. The armed individuals shot the man over 30 times. The suspect, who was part of a drug trafficking gang, lived in another state and had arrived in Piaui a week before the shooting. The perpetrators escaped. Motivations for the shooting are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 December 2023, in Teresina (Piaui), a group of people attacked a man, who was accused of stabbing a man to death in the East Zone of the city. The group threw stones at the man, who was injured and was taken to the hospital. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Paraguay); Police Forces of Paraguay (2013-)
notes: On 2 December 2023, in Carapegua (Paraguari), workers, administrative staff, and agents of the Municipal Traffic Police (PMT) protested and closed streets near the Municipality to demand the approval of the municipal budget that includes a salary increase for officials and councilors.

On 2 December 2023, in Zuata (Anzoategui), a group of residents demonstrated against the constant petrol seizures, and arbitrary arrests carried out by the police. During the demonstration, the residents attacked a CICPC police patrol vehicle with officials inside, breaking the car windows. There were no casualties.
